Pick up the new weapon at Silva's trading post
"Solve this and you will reach knighthood..."
"You reached knighthood, congratulations!"
"Solve this and we can prevent a war..."
"I will grant you one more chance!"
"You will be no longer part of my kingdom!"
Keep family and friends close. They give us purpose, they guide us. Please take this to some like-minded friends of mine.'
Potatoes are poisonous was the rumour at afternoon tea. I doubt it, but dreadful if true! Perhaps it's worth investigation?'
...then all proceeds to schedule- Oh, hello my young acquaintance. I presently have need of some dynamite, for a household project.'
I believe in slow penance for wrongdoers - counting grain, for example. You see, if even small crimes go unpunished, one's whole world may go to seed.'
I can't bear to know my people feel the chill. All I can think of is drapes for the windows. To keep from them the bitter winter soon to come.'
I make monument to someone special. Have I told you of my brother? He was a fine man, Benjamin. I think on him a great deal of late. A great deal.'
Earl Smedley is a danger to our poor vulnerable Queen! Twelve years ago he crushed my cat beneath his Landau. I have never forgotten.'
"I noticed a ship pretending to be a trading ship, then attacking other ships. Someone has to take care of it before it can cause even more trouble. Would you be so kind?"

"A pirate ship connected to my niece is in trouble. While I don't support what they do, most of them had everything taken away and they were forced down this path, just like she was. I simply cannot ignore family in need."
A plot against our frail young monarch! The ship may seem proper, but do not let yourself be fooled. Kill the snake, and secure our Queen a surer destiny.'
Shocking to hear rumours of dissidents nearby. Such a brazen threat to our inexperienced Queen. Play the patriot and stamp out the growing fire.'

"Someone found the necklace I lost years ago, but now their ship sank. It was a gift from my brother when I was young. An old woman like myself can have a strong sentimental attachment to things bringing back good memories."
"I saw an unfortunate ship get destroyed by a mysterious ship earlier, it looked like it belonged to those Pyphoreans. Seeing these wreckages reminds me of the tragedy, could you remove them dear?"
"A visiting ship forgot some cargo in my harbour. Would you be so kind to pick up and bring it to them my dear?"
"Poor guys, shipwrecked in a storm by the looks of it. I want to get to the bottom of this and ask them some brief questions, after which I will take care of their safety."

"Even though I don't approve of these pirates, I still want to make sure my niece is doing well. I prepared supplies for them and left them at the designated map point. My niece should be waiting for you at the border of the region."

"I tolerate many things, but someone has crossed the line by disturbing my brother's grave and throwing the decorations into the ocean. Could you retrieve them while I think of a proper, deserving approach?"
Her Majesty commends you to those of us on the royal council. It can only serve to increase that trust then, for her to see us sail together, and presume I also trust you.'
Some innocent merchants have had a bit of bother. Could you guide them to my harbour, where they will be quite safe?'

Hunt wants the player to escort a scientist who just made a "great discovery", the greatest discovery. Really. She will be able to save humanity.

She is afraid others might want to stop this or steal the knowledge/ideas, so asks for an escort just in case (do we spawn attackers?)

Maybe royale attackers? Or is this too direct?

She portrays the mission as "for the good of humanity", can't imagine anyone wanting to interfere - then there are a lot of attackers, makes the player wonder if intentions are good.
Lady Cumbersmythe embarks for the East African uplands, where her researches in cross-cultural musical variations require the distribution of a large volume of Gramophones.'
Her Majesty commissions a munificent banquet for important Antipodeans. We.. er.. neglected to factor in the post-prandial cigar posturing, which is so vital to the success of such evenings…'
A delicate matter. Her Majesty is lately aware of The Movement's ailing cause, and wishes to donate off-the-record. We trust you to keep it all on the quiet.'
I'm an avid wood carver you know. Yes, give me a chisel, a fishtail gouge or a mallet and I am quite content. The thing is, I'm so keen I've run rather short of planks!'
All the way from the equator, I don't blame them for feeling the chill. Her Majesty will be most vexed if we don't warm them up!'
Believe it or not, I used to have a wild streak. Wagered a castle against a fellow, and lost! The rashness of youth! Better do the honourable, and build it, hadn't I?!'
First impressions count! It's unthinkable that south sea dignitaries should catch a whiff of piracy during their visit - those bygone days are over!'
Sometimes we are delicate, other times we must pound the cream from the eclair, so to speak. Ma'am's favourites, The Movement, will suffer if enemy reinforcements reach the colonies!'
Her Majesty has lost enough, without also losing King Svalbard as a trade partner. The saboteurs of our once-doughty bond must be met head on!'
You know, the fools stole my least interesting sculptures! Still I'd rather such naive carvings weren't inflicted upon the general public!'
Oh goodness, the treaty cannot be signed unless the storm-wrecked delegation is returned to my harbour and restored with a good dose of smelling salts!'
The Maya expedition was a success, but rough seas have deposited one of Her Majesty's treasures en route. She would be most indebted if you could recover it.'
The Duchess of Powys can be quite lemony with me, but perhaps you could whizz by and explain the jolly mix-up - vigilant times, the sinking of her barge, etc.'
Her Majesty received an alarming missive over second breakfast. Threats to 'undermine' her authority. Perhaps you could bring the matter to a peaceful climax?'
The Movement is back - not that, my bowels are fine - I mean the group to whom Her Majesty may well be somewhat sympathetic. Could you ensure their safe passage?'
Viscount Foxweasel has borne a grudge ever since I smothered him in manure at public school initiation. He plans to sink my exhibition of recent carvings. Can you ensure it arrives intact?'
They are not traditionally a sailing nation you see, the hill-dwellers. Lost last time, and the time before that. Perhaps you can save us, and guide them in?'
"VIP - Sightseeing Trip Around the world! Show him around will you"

Archie needs the players help to escort an expedition he is either about to send out, or that is returning.

The expedition was to gather new types of wood he heard awesome rumors about, in an attempt to find the ultimate carving wood.

However, jealous competitors got word of it too, they might want to sabotage. So the player gets asked to help out.

"I am terribly excited to surprise Her Majesty on her birthday... the chocolate menagerie is of the utmost secrecy, we cannot have her finding out any of the intricate little details we have planned!"
"Oh, er, this is awkward. We wouldn't normally ask you to wade for flotsam. Trouble is, this particular cargo may or may not connect Her Majesty to Isabel Sarmento!"
"Lady Cumbersmythe embarks for the East African uplands, where her researches in cross-cultural musical variations require the distribution of a large volume of Gramophones."
"Her Majesty commissions a munificent banquet for important Antipodeans. We..er.. neglected to factor, the post-prandial cigar posturing, which is so vital to the success of such evenings..."
"A delicate matter. Her Majesty is lately aware of The Movement's ailing cause, and wishes to donate off-the-record. We trust you to keep it all on the quiet."
"I'm an avid wood carver you know. Yes, give me a chisel, a fishtail gouge or a mallet and I am quite content. The things is, I'm so keen, I've run rather short of planks!"
"All the way from the equator, I don't blame them for feeling the chill. Her Majesty will be most vexed if we don't warm them up!"
"Believe it or not, I used to have a wild streak. Wagered a castle against a fellow, and lost! The rashness of youth! Better do the honourable, and build it, hadn't I?!"
"First impressions count! It's unthinkable south sea dignitaries should catch a whiff of piracy during their visit - those bygone days are over!
"Sometimes we are delicate, other times we must pound the cream from the eclair, so to speak. Ma'am's favourites The Movement will suffer if enemy reinforcements reach the colonies!"
"Her Majesty has lost enough, without also losing King Svalbard as a trade partner. The saboteurs of our once-doughty bond must be met head on!"
"You know, the fools stole my least interesting sculptures! Still I'd rather such naive carvings weren't inflicted upon the general public! + mention that the ships are empty"
"Oh goodness, the treaty cannot be signed unless the storm-wrecked delegation is returned to my harbour and restored with a good dose of smelling salts!"
"The Maya expedition was a success, but rough seas have deposited one of Her Majesty's treasures en route. She would be most indebted if you could recover it."
"The Duchess of Powys can be quite lemony with me, but perhaps you could whizz by and explain the jolly mix-up - vigilant times, sinking of her barge, etc."
"Her Majesty received an alarming missive over second breakfast. Threats to 'undermine' her authority. Perhaps you could bring the matter to a peaceful climax?"
"The Movement is back - not that, my bowels are fine - I mean the group to whom Her Majesty may well be somewhat sympathetic. Could you ensure their safe passage?"
"Viscount Foxweasel has borne a grudge ever since I smothered him in manure at public school initiation. He plans to sink my exhibition of recent carvings. Can you ensure it arrives intact?"
"They are not traditionally a sailing nation you see, the hill-dwellers. Lost last time, and the time before that. Perhaps you can save us, and guide them in?"
"VIP - Sightseeing Trip Around the world! Show him around will you"

Archie needs the players help to escort an expedition he is either about to send out, or that is returning.

The expedition was to gather new types of wood he heard awesome rumors about, in an attempt to find the ultimate carving wood.

However, jealous competitors got word of it too, they might want to sabotage. So the player gets asked to help out.

"I am terribly excited to surprise Her Majesty on her birthday... the chocolate menagerie is of the utmost secrecy, we cannot have her finding out any of the intricate little details we have planned!"
"Oh, er, this is awkward. We wouldn't normally ask you to wade for flotsam. Trouble is, this particular cargo may or may not connect Her Majesty to Isabel Sarmento!"
If you think we want courage, sharkbait, I'll dice you. Our bellies are good and full o' fire - drink's just something to do as we watch the world burn!'
I'm a pirate through-and-through. What keeps us bound is the code! If my lads give life and leg for the fight, only right they get what's shiny.'
If he has one-leg, one-arm, or three of each, don't matter. I polish what I find. That means you too, dogsack! Equip my fresh blood, or suffer.'
"Don't think I won't strap fire to my breast and charge your throne rooms, if you don't bring me more of it."
"I've got the ear of those on the fence. The pot is stirred. Arm them with yer biggest cannons, and I won't use you as live ammunition."
"We've as much tradition as the crown pimple, or have you never danced the boards with a picaroon? P'haps it's ye who needs to take a walk!?"
"Goon at the tavern reckons I'm still nobility. Set him straight biscuit-eater, in the most low-down way you're able."

"If you so much as whisper cliché, I'll smash you in the gnarly bits. Get me a proper pirate parrot, or I'll make a brush from yer hair and smoke yer fingers for sausages. + should say something about the kidnapping and that it is as a security measure that he behaves"
"None more entitled than Lord Spillikin, greasy hands in paupers' pockets. How about we give him the special treatment he thinks himself so worthy of?"
"Might spare your worthless life if you do me a turn. Cut off their Beluga, and the richies will bawl out their eyes, with nothing to hoover up their piggy noses."
"Sparing deserters makes me as weak as they. Besides, the slippy eel knows my plans. Show 'em what becomes of cowards, or I'll have to show you."
"There's nowhere to hide when you don't pay Anne. No route to be took we won't find and strip yer gizzard. Shew the merchants how we value their custom."
Just received big news from my crew. They managed to steal the ship of someone trusted by the queen. With this, we will be able to get very close to her, I can't risk anything happening to it.

"Some Idiot fell asleep last night without realising that the ship wasn't knot correctly! + Falling asleep on duty is fine but the punishment should be funny and yet cruel and dangerous - slightly over the top!"

"One of my people, Crazy Pixie, robbed and killed an advisor of the Queen. I am obviously very proud of her, but doing so netted her a huge bounty, causing everyone and their mother to be on the hunt for her. She needs to temporarily law low."

"Lady Lydia Rosemund is a wealthy business woman, whom is very close to her brother. The same brother who is currently tied up in my harbor, and about to provide me some ransom money. However, hired mercenaries are sent my way, so he has to be relocated."
Help anne identify some lazy pirates
Story
"Suicide missions send you back stiff, with a coin on yer tongue. Since those chicken-livers snuck out alive, I'll just have to stuff it somewhere else."
"We shouldda had more booty, I'm sure of it. Go back to the spot and see if there isn't more left of that wimpish trader!"
"A message in a bottle with a golden tooth was found near our harbour! They begging for help as they floating near the queens puppies island! Might be another Recruit in the making!"
Story
Story
Story
Story
Story
Story
Story
Story
Story
Story
Better get used to us ruling these waters again! Begone!
Destroy the pirate ship to stop the pirates from resettling
Arggh, don't think it's over, we'll be back!
Piracy will prevail, we will take back what's ours!
"If you think we want courage, sharkbait, i'll dice you. Our bellies are good and full o' fire - drink's just something to do as we watch the world burn!"
"I'm a pirate through-and-through. What keeps us bound is the code! If my lads give life and leg for the fight, only right they get what's shiny."
"If he has one-leg, one-arm, or three of each, don't matter. I polish what I find. That means you too, dogsack! Equip my fresh blood, or suffer."
"Don't think I won't strap fire to my breast and charge your throne rooms, if you don't bring me more of it."
"I've got the ear of those on the fence. The pot is stirred. Arm them with yer biggest cannons, and I won't use you as live ammunition."
"We've as much tradition as the crown pimple, or have you never danced the boards with a picaroon? P'haps it's ye who needs to take a walk!?"
"Goon at the tavern reckons I'm still nobility. Set him straight biscuit-eater, in the most low-down way you're able."

"If you so much as whisper cliché, I'll smash you in the gnarly bits. Get me a proper pirate parrot, or I'll make a brush from yer hair and smoke yer fingers for sausages. + should say something about the kidnapping and that it is as a security measure that he behaves"
"None more entitled than Lord Spillikin, greasy hands in paupers' pockets. How about we give him the special treatment he thinks himself so worthy of?"
"Might spare your worthless life if you do me a turn. Cut off their Beluga, and the richies will bawl out their eyes, with nothing to hoover up their piggy noses."
"Sparing deserters makes me as weak as they. Besides, the slippy eel knows my plans. Show 'em what becomes of cowards, or I'll have to show you."
"There's nowhere to hide when you don't pay Anne. No route to be took we won't find and strip yer gizzard. Shew the merchants how we value their custom."
Just received big news from my crew. They managed to steal the ship of someone trusted by the queen. With this, we will be able to get very close to her, I can't risk anything happening to it.

"Some Idiot fell asleep last night without realising that the ship wasn't knot correctly! + Falling asleep on duty is fine but the punishment should be funny and yet cruel and dangerous - slightly over the top!"

"One of my people, Crazy Pixie, robbed and killed an advisor of the Queen. I am obviously very proud of her, but doing so netted her a huge bounty, causing everyone and their mother to be on the hunt for her. She needs to temporarily law low."

"Lady Lydia Rosemund is a wealthy business woman, whom is very close to her brother. The same brother who is currently tied up in my harbor, and about to provide me some ransom money. However, hired mercenaries are sent my way, so he has to be relocated."
Help anne identify some lazy pirates

"All who feels abandoned by society always know they can come to me. Those you have nothing left to loose make the best members. I have heard of a group of prisoners who managed to leave jail but we got no news from them since. They may very well be lost at sea. Find them and bring them back to me."
Suicide missions send you back stiff, with a coin on yer tongue. Since those chicken-livers snuck out alive, I'll just have to stuff it somewhere else.
"We shouldda had more booty, I'm sure of it. Go back to the spot and see if there isn't more left of that wimpish trader!"
"A message in a bottle with a golden tooth was found near our harbour! They begging for help as they floating near the queens puppies island! Might be another Recruit in the making!"
Do they really think they could hide forever? Deserting my crew, becoming my rivals. This won't go unpunished! I trust you have eyes everywhere, find them and send me a picture of their location.

These pirates of the Caribbean certainly must have it much nicer there! No threat of Empire, no grim old world. Still, I am certain I remain the more powerful of the two. Take a picture to confirm it!
If you are a famous smuggler, you are not doing it right. And I am afraid I have become a tad too famous lately. Bring this fragile crate with you, I have promised it to a very looked after friend.

I have full confidence in Mary. While being caught and about to be hanged on the jailor island, she pretended to be pregnant to avoid it. She bought herself a little time, it is our duty to use it to take her out.

Mate, you must know by now but .. I haven't always been a pirate. My father, Benjamin Harlow, was at the royal council but was murdered by the Mad King. An injustice I could never forgive. Blake is pretending to be affected but swear he had nothing to do with it. I will not take his word for it, I want proof. Go to his island and smuggle out all the accounts of the time you can.

I knew it! The documents prove that Blake has done nothing to help my father, inaction is as atrocious as if he had put the rope around his neck himself! But this also proves one thing: Blake was not the only one from the royal council letting my father die. I know have all their names, we will track hem down and kill them all, beginning with William Brawn. His little retirement cruise won't last much longer ...

Great job with Brawn. I hope he had time to see death coming, feeling the fear must have felt on the galore. Our next target might be tougher. Christine Purble has left the royal council years ago to establish herself in the colonies. Ask Jean La Fortune there, as pirate we must stand shoulder to shoulder, he will help. He will be waiting for you next to [Isabel island].

I know of Christine Purble. While not being part of the royal council anymore, she still feels she can enforce the Empire law on the other side of the world. Destroying her for revenge is fine, but this would also be a huge relief for us, I will help you. I will order my ships to attack as soon as you accept the mission.

You have done wonders. Only one more person is left to strike ... Blake. He never leaves the palace so he will be impossible to strike at sea, however we can definitively make him leave in fear. Friends, let's surround his island, block all communications, destroy his ships! Take this pirate flag, you are truly one of us now.

The Queen will never allow that! And she even has found some unkown pirate to help her! Despite all my sympathy for Anne Harlow's lost I cannot let her put our lives at risk any longer! Anne better prepare for the Queen's revenge.
Friend! Don't abandon us now, I see the Queen ships coming and I fear we won't be numerous enough to face her. Would you stand by my side, one last time?
Jean is at a loss of words before some of his enemies. He has asked you for weapons to back up his proposals.
Jean has lost a few too many ships lately and is in need for some materials to build new ones.
Times have changed, and the steam engine has forever reshaped the rules of naval combat. For Jean, you adapt or you die, which is why he has asked for your support in upgrading into steam ships.
Jean has had yet another bad experience with the last people he had to work with: one morning they were gone along with most of his people's supplies. He has been forced to ask for your help.
Jean needs your help keeping a close eye on a shipment that is on its way to his harbour, just in case the Empire tries to keep it from reaching its destination...
Do you dare venture in pirate territory? Jean has officially forwarded you an invitation to come see High Mountain and decide for yourself what you think of their struggle.
There is word of a slave owner nearby. Jean has asked you to sneak past his security and bring the man to him.
La Fortune leaves no one behind. After learning that Eli Bleakworth has one of his crewmembers locked up, he has asked you to sail to Wormways Prison to bail them out whichever way you can.
Eli is willing to let you have Jean's crewmember, as long as you sink the fugitives ship and bring them back to him.
You managed to convince Bleakworth to let you have Jean's mate in exchange for the escaped fugitives. All that's left to do now is crossing the ocean back to High Mountain.

Jean was separated from his parents when he was a child. He has now learned that one of the other slaves managed to escape and is now on Puerto de la Rosa. You might be able to find out more if you ask him.

Etienne had sad news about Jean's mother, but his father was still under the same master when he left. He believes you will find information about him in the slave records, but they are very heavily guarded and sneaking past the patrols will not be easy.

The records seem to indicate Jean's father last owner was William Ward. There are rumours about a slave ship en route near Puerto de la Rosa. Jean has asked you to take a picture of the ship to see if it belongs to Ward.
Whomever is on board of Ward's slave ship is Jean's only lead to find his father. He plans to attack the ship and wants you to fight by his side.

I was schooled in the language of violence the hard way, some understand no other diplomacy than the tip of a cannon. Were you to provide us with... arguments to defend our cause, I'd personally repay you.

Our particular trade depends on ships, as you very well know by now, but we have had a few more casualties than expected lately. I would be in your debt if you could supply materials for our future assets.
Steam vessels lack the elegance of sails, but this game cannot be won unless you adapt fast to the new rules. Bring us what we need to upgrade our fleet and La Fortune's people will remember.

As used as I am to backstabbing by now, it never gets any easier. These... associates of mine ran off with my people's food. I hate to ask but my hands are tied here, I will take any bread you can spare.
I have a very important shipment incoming, but the Empire must not know we are the recipients or they will intercept it. I rest easier if you were to watch over it from under your impartial flag.
You have proven a good friend to me and my people. I believe you will be able to understand what we are doing here. Come visit some time, see for yourself what true freedom looks like.
La Fortune's people don't bite, right? I hope you look upon us with kinder eyes now that you understand why we were had to resort to the outlaw ways... Take this, the people gathered it for you.

A man appeared at our shores seeking refuge from a slave owner. He's well protected, but they will not see you coming. Bring him to me, we'll show him what we do to those who like to bargain with human lives...

That weasel Bleakworth has one of my crewmembers locked up on the other side of the world. He has no use for them other than to torment me. I'm not getting anywhere close that imperialist scum's claws, but I'm sure you will find a way to break them free.

Right when I thought you couldn't stoop any lower you come here doing chores for a pirate. But you are right, this worm lets off nothing about Jean. You can have them... Provided you bring these fugitives back to their cells.
Good. These criminals will be punished accordingly... Now take this filth away from my sight. Let Jean enjoy his time with them while he still can...
You crossed an ocean to save a person you didn't even know! Maybe you are someone I can call friend after all... You have my gratitude, and my people's.

Mon poteau, may I confide in you...? I still get bad dreams from the days I was a slave. I got sold to another landowner when I was but a child and never saw manman or papa again. I heard uncle Etienne escaped and lives a peaceful life in Puerto de la Rosa, he may know what happened to them...

Jean? Of course I remember the little rascal! I earnt my freedom years ago. His manman sadly passed away, but his papa was still under the same master when I left. They keep the records well guarded, but they will lead you to him if you can get them.

These records... They are outdated, but there is a name: William Ward. I know it is a long shot, but my father might still be with him. I heard rumours of a slave ship near Puerto de la Rosa. If you can take a picture, I can see if it is our man or not.
It is him! They won't take my father away from me again, we strike now! Join me, my friend!

My father... was not amongst them. The other slaves knew him, he passed not long ago... It's ok, friend, it was a peaceful death. We returned the ownership of their lives to these men and women. Most of us are former slaves, they will be welcomed in our independent nation. Thank you for bringing me peace, mon poteau, and for reminding me what we fight for.
"While Jean and I have a very different approach, we share a goal in which we face a common enemy. If he does well, it benefits the movement as well."

I have three ships ready to set out and help the people from a recently liberated piece of land. La Corona did not even provide them enough food or good clothes. I cannot wait to take action against these animals, but we have to be patient.
The enemy is using the latest technology, and we have to adapt if we want to keep up. We have been offered engineering help, but we lack the required materials.

The strength of the movement will only increase as we expand our territory. I have my eyes set on certain pieces of land, belonging to private owners. I will need a good amount of gold to compensate them.
La Corona are way out of line torturing and killing local people. Even though we can't openly act, they have to be stopped, I can't bare seeing this.

I have reports coming in of a group of colonial war ships entering the region. I don't know what they are up to, but last time we did not act, things got nasty. I learned the hard way that in these situations its either them or us.

George Smith, a man I deeply respect for his actions, recently helped us out by sending a scout ship. He successfully identified La Corona were delivering weapons. Please make sure his efforts are not in vain.

I am very much against it, but I am afraid not giving in to the current request to take action against an La Corona ship visiting us, will cause internal conflict or even a division. One united movement will be required to win this battle.

La Corona started rapidly construction a huge bridge. This bridge means they have a much stronger position, preventing it is our top priority. I already noticed several ships carrying materials, those are easy targets.

An important, secret weapon delivery got disturbed by an inspection. The ones helping us were forced to drop the cargo overboard to not get into trouble themselves. Luckily I got word of the location.
What is happening here in the region bothers me, more than you can imagine. But engaging in a battle we cannot yet win is not the way to go. These members of the movement tried and failed.

I heard disturbing news from my family. They are in need of medical supplies which they are not getting. I have some ready, including a letter for them, and arranged a good friend who is willing to head there, but she cannot be seen near my harbour.
Sometimes these waters can catch ships by surprise. In this case, I saw a Corona ship get wrecked. I want to have the wreckages of the ship analyzed to understand what we are currently up against.

La Corona complicate everything. These pigs think they own everything, even the region's waters. Just the other day they halted my shipment of trading supplies, and took it all. I arranged the next shipment to be dropped at a designated map point, so this won't happen again.

Bente Jorgensen has her heart in the right place. She came here to help as soon as she heard of the situation. However, the poor thing has no idea what she is getting herself into. I don't want her to get involved.
The empire has been helping us out in secret. Another ship with supplies will soon arrive again, but La Corona have stepped up their presence in the area. I am afraid it will not reach us.
I sent out a ship to gather information on La Corona and what their next move might be. I got word the ship returned with crucial information, and we can't afford to have it travel unguarded.

We managed to get these children away from La Corona. My harbor has been a safe haven for them, but they are still in the middle of conflict. They will travel to a safer place with this ship, and I want to ensure their safe leave.
If every guard had a pocket watch, I would never again feel we are somehow running at the leisurely pace preferred by the ruddy prisoners!'
Dying prematurely in one's cell is the easy way. Since a fair few of the rotters are on their last legs, I need you to help me feed them back from the brink.'
They nearly clawed their way out last night. Every damn cage needs bolstering, if we are to keep humanity's vermin confined!'
It's only a matter of time before the sea is free of pirate-kind. But Her Majesty's mercenaries must have the arms to match them!'
I never drink, but turnkeys must. Do you have lubricant to keep their keys turning smooth?'
Stay here too long, go insane. But some arrive mad, and want cells thick enough not all of us have to hear their frenzy.'
Damnation! My gunboat as getaway? By all means use lethal force, but only if absolutely necessary will you destroy my ship!'
The woman is a blatant criminal who would be dangling from the gallows, if not for lack of evidence. Yes, I know one when I see one!'
Release a life-long fraudster just because he has unscrupulous friends on the royal council? Bend the law, and the law bends you!'
Holy Bibles in which escape tools have been secreted, are extremely unlikely to pass me by. Pursue the smugglers and burn their sacrilegious stock!'
Floating bottles may look innocuous to a lay person, but messages inside facilitate a significant number of escapes. They must be collected for me to smash.'
You might think we have enough slippery characters, but it's for me to see they clean up their acts. Find the missing surfactants or I'll die of this stench!'
We know the H.M.S Murgatroyd was sunk by a detainee of mine. It disgusts me that he is to be released. There must be some evidence against him among the wreckage!'
Three swam for it in the riot. Bring the silly sods back, or they'll drown. They will serve the full sentence!'
This man is to be taken to a place of execution. A kindness if you ask me, but the verdict is apparently contentious.'
The ship carrying a Category A is overdue. Find it and bring him in. I have the isolation block ready, I'm certain he'll feel right at home.'
My superiors have no idea what it's like out here, deep in the filth. Yet I'm obliged to powder their noses. Can I trust you to preserve their blissful ignorance?'
Once a criminal, always a criminal. But the occasional snitch gets ''mercy'', and the others don't like it. I need you to keep the rats from the cats.'
"Dying prematurely in one's cell is the easy way. Since a fair few of the rotters are on their last legs, I need you to help me feed them back from the brink."
"They nearly clawed their way out last night. Every damn cage needs bolstering, if we are to keep humanity's vermin confined!"
"Stay here too long, go insane. But some arrive mad, and want cells thick enough not all of us have to hear their frenzy."
"If every guard had a pocket watch, I would never again feel we are somehow running at the leisurely pace preferred by the ruddy prisoners!"
"It's only a matter of time before the sea is free of pirate-kind. But Her Majesty's mercenaries must have the arms to match them!"
"I never drink, but turnkeys must. Do you have lubricant to keep their keys turning smooth?"
"Damnation! My gunboat as getaway? By all means use lethal force, but only if absolutely necessary, will you destroy my ship!"
"The woman is a blatant criminal who would be dangling from the gallows, if not for lack of evidence. Yes, I know one when I see one!"
"Release a life-long fraudster just because he has unscrupulous friends on the royal council? Bend the law, and the law bends you!"
"Holy Bibles in which escape tools have been secreted, are extremely unlikely to pass me by. Pursue the smugglers and burn their sacrilegious stock!"
"We know the H.M.S Murgatroyd was sunk by a detainee of mine. It disgusts me he is to be released. There must be some evidence against him among the wreckage!"
"Floating bottles may look innocuous to a lay person, but messages inside facilitate a significant number of escapes. They must be collected for me to smash."
"You might think we have enough slippery characters, but it's for me to see they clean up their acts. Find the missing surfactants or I'll die of this stench!"
"Three swam for it in the riot. Bring the silly sods back, or they'll drown. They will serve the full sentence!"
"The ship carrying a Category A is overdue. Find it and bring him in. I have the isolation block ready, I'm certain he'll feel right at home."
"My superiors have no idea what it's like out here, deep in the filth. Yet I'm obliged to powder their noses. Can I trust you to preserve their blissful ignorance?"
"Once a criminal, always a criminal. But the occasional snitch gets 'mercy', and the others don't like it. I need you to keep the rats from the cats."
"This man is to be taken to place of execution. A kindness if you ask me, but the verdict is apparently contentious."

Pearls, I love threading them. However, my current supplier was acting up, so I told him that he is no longer needed. I want to show him my words have meaning, and that he truly is instantly replaceable.

Looks like I have run out of Champagne. Don't you sometimes wonder how things would look if you made a different decision somewhere in the past? It's so fascinating how decisions result in chains of irreversible consequences.
Customers repeatedly ask me for these Pocket Watches. I don't exactly find them exotic, but seems that I might be able to make good money with them. I would like to try a sample batch.
My next shipment will not be here for a while, and some of my stocks completely depleted. It would be foolish not to take money when I have the possibility to do so.

Maintaining social contacts and status is very important, something you will learn at some point. For this reason I don't want to disappoint an old client, although I don't do these things myself anymore.

An old friend in need reached out to me. He made a huge mistake; told the client it was done without confirming himself. Turns out the target is alive and well, here in the Old World. If the client finds out it could cost him his live.

Under normal circumstances I would just feel sorry for these sad, petty criminals. but they decided to steal from one of my shipments this time around. If I would be dealing with it myself, I would cut off their hands.

I recognized a ship as being part of the organization that once betrayed me. Its presence in the region might be a complete coincidence, but it might have come to track me down, a risk I am not willing to take.

One could argue killing people is never a good thing, but I would say they are wrong. The jobs I took helped the world get rid of some terrible people. But this local assassin is only in it for the money, taking every job.

Suhail Salim Rostamina, a Sheikh with great power and influence is visiting the region. We did some business before, but I want to further invest and refresh his memory. Make sure to mention Madame Kahina sent you!

Years ago I made a mistake and took a job I should not have. It left the wife and children of my target in a bad position. From time to time, I arrange an anonymous delivery for them, containing things they might need. It soothes me knowing they do well.

You show up just at the right time. Perhaps a bit boring, but I have a small job for you. One crate of this client's purchase was accidentally left behind by the ship picking it up. I do miss the thrill of my old life in my moments like these.

Someone I used to know is running from authorities. She needed to get rid of a few pieces of evidence, and notified me where she left them. I am afraid I have to provide them to the authorities, she should have been more careful.

This client requested their purchase to be delivered to their ship rather than coming to pick them up. While small requests like these annoy me, take my word for it when I tell you the importance of gaining people's respect and keeping them close.
I have always been a role-model citizen, so there is nothing to compensate for, but from time to time, I donate things I can miss so they end up with those needing them.
I couldn't explain you why exactly, but an eerie feeling has been bothering me ever since this morning. I can't help but feel something bad is about to happen.
Friends from back home are paying me a visit. These are the type of people at the very top of society, used to nothing but the best. They surely expect a proper escort.
The side effect of providing exotic high-value wares is that it has the tendency to attract certain buyers. The kind that feels too important to travel without escort.
I have a very expensive shipment coming in soon. The value is likely beyond what you can imagine. Point is, it is the kind of shipment one does not allow to travel unguarded.

This lord claims he no longer purchases from me because he is too afraid of pirates to send his ships into the region. An excuse of course, but I knew how to deal with it. I offered him an escort, and guess who is buying again.
Farmer would like to give you her aunt unheritance.
Farmer would like to give you something she found while digging her field.
Farmer would like to give her extra production of potatoes.
Farmer would like to give you a seagull she caught.
Nu-uh, too lanky!
His teeth are crooked as a donkey's!
Ugh, look at his spotless shirt, such arrogance!
Look at those scrawny shoulders! He'll snip in half if he tries to lift two potatoes!
Haven't you seen those dead fish eyes? He gives me the creeps!
He couldn't tell his mother from a sheep!
Too fancy for my taste.
Farmer asks you to find her escaped pigs.
The farmer's husband has disappeared again, she needs help to find him.
Farmer is anxious and hopes you will find her missing child.
Farmer wants to find a man to marry and asks for your help to find the best one.
Farmer's cat has escaped and his running around the city.
Farmer asks for your help in locking the stray hounds away.
Farmer needs help dealing with the fox which eats all her hens.
Farmer had her pigs stolen by one of the Willington's brothers. She needs help identifying which one is guilty.
Farmer's farm animals have escaped, she needs help finding them.
He... he might do! Hmm, yes, I shall give this one a chance.
Farmer hopes you can take a picture of an alapaca farm in the new world.
Farmer wishes you take a picture of the wedding occuring at the church.
Farmer would like a picture of the cows at the International Agricultural Show for farmers craft to be recognized.
Farmer wishes you take a picture of her son in front of the fire station.
Farmer would like to build a fountain.
Farmer wants a tool shed.
Farmer would like a tree to rest in the shade.
Farmer would like to receive plantain.
Farmer would like canned food for her wedding feast.
Farmer things winter will be rough so more wood is needed.
Farmer asks for help finding the mysterious man she met in the forest.
Farmer wants to give you a quest.
Worker would like to give you a gift.
Worker would like to give you a gift.
Worker doesn't find his pals in the city to meet for the socialist congress.
Worker needs help finding his mates.
Worker needs help finding his runaway son.
Worker wants the man rioting alone to be stopped.
Worker needs help to find the opium house.
Worker needs to find the herbalist house.
He... he might do! Hmm, yes, I shall give this one a chance.
We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig in our mine the whole day through!
To dig dig dig dig dig dig dig is what we really like to do!
It ain't no trick to get rich quick if you dig dig dig with a shovel or a pick.
In a mine! Where a million diamonds shine! We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig from early morn till night.
We dig up diamonds by the score! A thousand rubies, sometimes more!
But we don't know what we dig 'em for. We dig dig dig a-dig dig, heigh-ho! It's home from work we go.
Worker wants a picture of him in the fight club.
Worker would like a picture of all of his comrades in front of the factory.
Worker would like to have his photo taken while he is protesting against bourgeoisie.
Worker needs an hospital built.
Worker would like sewing machines.
Worker would like to taste chocolate.
Worker would like to taste Champagne.
Worker would like to organize a barbecue.
Worker needs bricks.
Worker wants to give you a quest.
Artisan would like to receive ponchos.
Artisan wants coffee.
Artisan wants rum.
Artisan wants sails.
Artisan would like to find a farmer family ready to teach him the job.
Artisan would like to meet the grand music composer.
Artisan daughter is singing in the hills and needs to be brought back to town.
Artisan needs to find his lost cousin.
Artisan wants the grand tragedian to be welcomed in person by the governor.
Artisan needs help finding the runaway apprentice.
Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...!
These modern fancies... He'll be broken by noon! Forget it!
He'll only be a burden! We have no time for such nonsense!
He wants to work a simple life? Fine, he shall work! Bring him to us!
Artisan wants a picture of your New World island.
Artisan needs a picture of the back to school day as a souvenir for his daughter.
Artisan would like a picture of him taking the community children to the zoo.
Artisan would like a picture of the shop grand opening.
Artisan needs a picture to be taken of his duel to prove his love to a lady.
Artisan wants a new museum exhibition.
Artisan would like to give you a book.
Artisan would like to give an artefact from the warriors of the past.
Artisan would like to give you his masterpiece.
Artisan advice you to visit the Annual Artisan Fair.
Artisan would like to give you a gift for your loss of time.
Artisan would like you to choose who is the best poet.
Artisan wants to give you a quest.
Engineer would like to give you her newest invention.
Engineer would like to give you seeds for new plants to grow on your island.
Engineer would like to introduce you to a doctor ready to work for you.
Engineer would like to teach to Workers' children to grant them a better life.
Engineer would like you to meet with El Professor, a man who whishes to visit the city bank.
Engineer would like you to help Charles Darwin to conduct his study on evolution.
Engineer would like you to stop the Shelley couple from pulling pranks on gullible town people.
Engineer would like to find the exotic animals lost on your island.
Engineer would like to have a picture of her daughter and her in front of the university for graduation day.
Engineer would like to prove to people she worked on the steam engine.
Engineer would like to have a picture of her taken in front of a factory.
Engineer would like to have a picture of a train.
Engineer would like to receive tallow and quartz sand for her experiments.
Engineer would like coffee for her study group.
Engineer would like food to feed all her lab helpers.
Engineer would like high-wheelers to move in the city faster.
Engineer would like light bulb to prove to people the benefit of it.
Engineer would like you to solve her enigma.
Engineer would like you to solve her enigma.

An Investor would like to give you part of his manufacture surplus as a thank you for your support for local enterprise.
An Investor would like to sell you gramaphones at the discounted price of 100 000 credits, since his usual partner bailed on him.
An Investor would like to give you an unwanted souvenir from a recent trip.
An Investor would like to offer you a machine to use in a factory, believing it may herald a new era of plenititude.
An Investor wants to lay on the after-party for your marvellous new exhibition, just so that his name might be associated with the project.
The paper boy delivered old news to an Investor, who is now desperate for someone to get him the very latest stocks and shares.
Having peeled back the curtains, an Investor sighted an streaker in his locality, and hopes you can put the wayward fellow in a straightjacket.
An investor has lost his darling kitten, help him find the poor defenceless little mog.
An Investor needs someone to convince his competitors away from the markets he has interests in, believing that not all competition in business is healthy.
An Investor has noticed the many wealthy visitors arriving in the city, and believes there cannot fail to be a new business partner for him among them.
A miserly Investor wants you to find his employee, and inform him he is to work through Christmas, regardless of his family's hopes.
An Investor recommends headhunting new talent for your company. It is his belief that the Queen's diplomatic offices might prove to be a prime hunting ground.
Investor wants you to take a picture of his cheating wife.
Investor wants his picture taken to be a role model for the workers.
Investor would like a picture of him in front of his factory.
Investor would like a picture of him and his employee's family celebrating Christmas.

Investor wants you to give him products to distract him.

Jornalero needs you to find the escaped alpacas.
Jornalero needs you to deal with the dangerous crocodiles near the city.
Jornalero needs you to take care of the sharks threatening the pearl divers lives.
Jornalero hope you can give a letter to a woman he once knew.
Jornalero would like you to have a strange gift a pirate gave to his son.
Jornalero is forced by his family to have a family portrait taken.
Jornalero would like to have a picture of himself taken to put on the ancestor altar once he passes.
Jornalero would like to have a picture a big sail ship.
Jornalero considers that the traditions will only be respected once a church is built.
Jornalero hopes you can build a new house for a poor man who lost everything in a fire.
Jornalero would like to build guitars for the whole community.
Jornalero would like to build toys for the children.
Jornalero would like to cool a fresh meal for all the poor in the community.

Obrero would like to show her country as progressist by taking pictures of women at work.
Obrero would like to receive weapons to send her revolutionary friend under the yock of La Carona.
