Ask farmers to introduce the artisan to a simpler life
Me poor auntie, God rest her soul, left this for me, but whatever would I want it for? I'm sure a cultured one like yerself would appreciate her legacy propper.
Twas a day like any other, ploughing the field, when m'boy dug this thing up! You like these, don't ye? Don't worry, we already scrubbed it clean.
Tatoes for dinner, 'tatoes for lunch, 'tatoes for breakfast... I'm so sick of potatoes, please rid us of the bloody stuff!
I caught this scamp gobbling all my fish up, but I couldn't bear to hurt it. Will you give him a home?
Huh, what a dimwit, he cannot put two words together! I need someone who is in my level, a man of the law... A police officer!
He is so serious! I would die of boredom with a man like that by my side! Don't you know someone who knows how to have fun? Maybe someone at the pub?
Oh, the stench, the depravity, no! You really don't get it, do you? He must be attractive and inteligent, fun yet a decent gentleman! A man of the world! Check the piers!
Look at those scrawny shoulders! He'll snip in half if he tries to lift two potatoes!
Haven't you seen those dead fish eyes? He gives me the creeps!
He couldn't tell his mother from a sheep!
Too fancy for my taste.
My pigs! Gov'nor, you need to help me. See, they've escaped their pen. They're all we got, please get them back!
Hubby's a terrific firefighter, but he has the habit of dissapearing after his shift. Last time they found'im passed out by the pub and I'm worried sick he might have fallen somewhere...
Gov'nor! Seen my child? Oh, that little rascal, always getting in trouble with that Spuds kid... If you find him, tell him he's going to be the death of me!
I swear there is no man in this whole town fit fer me! Look at me! My beauty does not compare to these peasants! You know everyone here, don't you? Find me an attractive husband, like a firefighter!
Ma vache! Elle est perdu! Find ma petite Antoinette, I beg of you, she surely doesn't know her way back home...!
Bloody hounds have the whole neighbourhood terrorised. Sooner or later a kid's going to end up bitten! Lock them away, ye must!
Damned wild animals are eating all my hens! Poor things are so terrified they haven't laid an egg in weeks. Please, gov'nor, catch the rascals!
Me pig's been stolen! It's one of the Willington lads I tell ye! See this big 'W' in the mud? Only their fancy boots leave prints like that!
Me livestock! Hubs made fun of me when I told him they were up to summat... They all ran away! Our living depends on them, find them, please!
Oh, how passionate and inspiring! Yes, I shall give this one a chance... For now.
Oi, heard they've sheep with looong necks on t'other side of the world. I'd kill to see one of those!
Who would have said the Montane child would one day marry the Capitule lass! Take a daguerrotype of the happy couple to remind their families the love that brought them together, will ye?
Me Dorothy and I have been preparing for this the whole year: the Cow Beauty Pageant! Or agricultural fair as the others like to call it... Document this wonderful event, yes?
Me child's a firefighters' fanatic! He wishes to join the local squad when he grows up. It'd mean the world to him if you could take a picture of the firestation to hang by his bedside.
Doctor's told me to stop carrying heavy buckets of water to and fro, but I've many mouths to feed! If only there was a fountain nearby...
There's been another accident with the tools we left laying around, someone's goint to get killed one day! Build a kiosk so we can store them safely, will you?
My father's too old to be ploughing the fields, but he refuses to stay home! A little shade to keep his head cool would go a long way, if you can spare a tree or two around here.
Us farmers have devouted our whole lowly life to harvesting, but none's ever tasted the long yellow fruit they grow in the New World! Wish we could try them at least once in our lifetime...
I was hoping to have something really fancy for my wedding feast. You think you can get me some of that odd food in metal boxes that the rich enjoy so much?
Neighbourhood had no time to prepare for the winter, and me ma's knee forecasts a specially wicked one this year. Have you some timber to spare for the fireplace...?

I went mushroom picking in the forest and met the most wonderful man, but we were so caught up in the moment that I forgot to ask his name! Do you think I might find him at the pub? Or maybe he's more of a club gentleman...?
I waited for hours, but he never came... I guess we were not meant to be... Still, thank you for caring, yer a true friend.
There he was, like you said! He was so happy to see me as well! We will remember your help, please take this with our thanks.
You know, Guv, I haven't had a thing to complaint about in weeks. Not feeling like meself, honestly. I would even like to give you a gift... What's happening to me?
We've so much, Guv, even me orphans are plump. Little Olly just this morning told me "Sir, can I not have some more?". Poor things gave me this for you.
Those dimwits, skipping our union meeting to drink the second I look away... My comrades need to hear my proposal! Lend me your authority to gather them up, Guv.
Me pals, they're so short, you see, they always lose their way to the mines. Good thing is we always make sure to move in a line. Help me find me pals before they miss their shift, yes?
My boy's passionate about the worker's struggle. Maybe too much. See, he's been running around town in a cart handing leaflets and refusing to 'be oppressed by his bedtime'...
It's always the same with Old Harold! We arranged our protest on the nineteenth, but out he goes on the ninth all on his own. His bad hearing is going to cost us our reputation! Please shut him up.
Could you point me the way to Ah Sing's house? He's got... good ways of making one forget about the hardships of work. It should be easy to spot by the- er... vapour.
Miss Alethea's concoctions can clear soot clogged lungs in a whim! She lives high up in the mountains tho, and this cough has me too feeble to climb meself...
We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig in our mine the whole day through!
To dig dig dig dig dig dig dig is what we really like to do!
It ain't no trick to get rich quick if you dig dig dig with a shovel or a pick.
In a mine! Where a million diamonds shine! We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig from early morn till night.
We dig up diamonds by the score! A thousand rubies, sometimes more!
But we don't know what we dig 'em for. We dig dig dig a-dig dig, heigh-ho! It's home from work we go.
How am I supposed to brag about punch club if I can't talk about punch club? Oh, I know! The rules didn't say anything about takings pictures...! Meet us at the iron mine.

Me mates and I have shared so many moments working at the brick factory... Jimmy's birthday is coming up and there would be no gift more perfect than a framed picture of the place that brought us together.
Can you believe!? Those pigs won't let us in on their precious club. We'll let them know what they can kiss, those... burgoise. You might want to have your camera ready!
All this smoke and soot takes a real tool on our bodies. My oldest, she's gotten sick as I've never seen her before. Don't we have a place we can take her to?
Our work clothes get stuck in the machines day in and day out. We spend our nights stitching every rip back together! Sure would be nice to have some of those fancy sewing machines...
These nuveau riche parading their luxuries around while most of us lowly workers have never tasted a single droplet of cocoa! Even things out, boss!
I just became a precious little girl's papa, Guv! We need something fancier to toast just this once, for my baby. You could get us some champagne, right?
The community could use some bonding. Help me organise a good old fashioned barbecue, yes? Just get the sausages and bread and I'll take care of the rest!
So... My mates wanted to see who's stronger and turns out I won, but... I may or may not need bricks to... rebuild something. Please?
Er, is this what champagne tastes like? I'll be sticking to beer then, thank you very much.
It would be wonderful if everyone in my cricle were clothed in soft natural fibres! Such timeless and modest garb, surely will be very little trouble to import!
Coffee! It must be how Engineers maintain such focus! If I too were worthy of these enchanted beans, I am sure, given time, I might filter the pre-eminent brew of our age!
Comic opera requires authenticity as much as any theatre, and the audience will jeer me if the pirates do not all swig rum for the duration...
Steam shall never supercede sail in the imagination! I envision canopies of sail above shell-lined walkways, seascapes, and mariner's paraphernalia...
Woe! I long for a bucolic life! Perhaps some rural farming family might take me in, and share the very precious simplicity of their lives with me?
Erwan Grogg is here! Touring incidental music he composed for a modernist masterwork! If I do not faint, please, I beseech you, will you introduce us? He is sure to be in front of the theatre!
My daughter is a free spirit. She roams the hills, singing, picking edelweiss. I only regret she must come down and join the multitude— for I need her in the shop.
In the pastry section— a genius. In a new city— a fruitcake! Last time I saw him he was at the bakery, who knows where he is now!
At the visitor harbour! Surely you have heard of Mr. Joseph Jefferson, tragedian nonpareil?! His brilliance merits the grandest of welcomes!
When I could not see his red chemise, I glanced up, and understood my apprentice had gone. (sigh) Perhaps I am no natural figure of authority...
Please! The first days may well test my resolve, but my heart is wild! It shall carry me through!
But I shan't be any burden, I shall be lighter than the country air! And for the dust, I can always wear gloves?
Oh thank you, thank you. Saved indeed, saved!... You don't imagine the labour will be too arduous, do you?

O, for a taste of distant shores and foreign lips and the elegant shadows of slender leaves...! Still, I cannot leave my earthly prison... To see that paradise, if only in a still picture, would take my breath away...
My precious Annabel is about to commence her lifelong voyage of learning! She will shine a light so bright on the world— I must have a picture of her with her fellow pupils!
Please, a photograph of us at the zoo! We may never again have the chance before our little Timothy succumbs to his illness.
The grand opening! Finally, grandfather's canning plan comes true! A picture will inspire my own grandchildren to preserve...ha!...the business forever...
Dubois would take my lovely Rebecca away, but I shall not let him! A photograph of the duel shall prove the lengths to which I am willing to go for her!
Seen all there is to see! And if the museum so ceases to stimulate, I am left with naught but my inner monologue, and little in life terrifies more than that!
This is one of my great favourites, I have long sought a like-minded soul with whom I might share it!
Ah, the turbulence of the past is never so dreadful as that of the present! Indeed, I find these ancient artefacts of war quite romantic, as I hope, you will also!
It is finally finished! My life's work in art. Dare I dream that by accepting this gift, you intend to make it a centrepiece for the world to admire?
It's my favourite time of the year again, the best craftsmen in town all gather for the annual artisan fair! Aren't you excited to greet them and contemplate their masterful work?
Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...! Please, take this for the loss of time.
These two men claim they are the best poets in the city! Please settle their argument, choose the one you prefer.

Roses are red.

Violets are blue.

Onions stink.

And so do you.

My head is full of random stuff,

Like rusty bread and bits of fluff.

And talking pies with googly eyes,

And stupid stuff that doesn't rhyme.
I really hope this final prototype will function as designed outside of a laboratory. Perhaps you would be willing to put it through its paces?
These seeds are the product of years of painstaking plant grafting in our botanical nurseries. This crop should now grow on your island as if in its natural climes!

It is far too common to see the poor suffer ill health— from smoking chimneys, or the miasma of the mines! It is the life's work of one of my esteemed peers. If you have a position available, I am sure they would work wonders!

Charles Darwin, one of the greatest minds of the century is in town! He has been conducting studies about evolution but some of his experience subjects have escaped and are running in the city. If you help him I am sure he would agree to work for you. Start with the fishes close to the harbour!
Great! That's the first animal of his experiment! Could you find his crocodiles now?
Wonderful! Just need the baboon and we are all set!
I just spoke to mister Darwin, he is thrilled to work with a patron so understanding as you. He agrees to move in the city!

All these children, sent to the factories as soon as they learn to walk! Such a pity! A child should have a chance to learn to read and acquire skills! Please, convince some workers parents that this is the best for their child, I am willing to teach them for free.
Mmh, I can send her my child but there is no way that I am feeding this useless mouth, she will have to take care of it as well!
What a wonderful opportunity! I wished I had the same when I was a child.
Leaning is the best way for my daughter to understand the pressure classes put on us and fight them effectively!
I do need the money my daughter brings by going to the factory but if this allow her to do better than me in life ...
Teaching to children? What a weird idea, mine learnt everything she had to know by living the real life!
What is she? Some kind of Jean Valjean? Fair enough, let her take care of my son but she better not complain when he will do his usual shenanigans.

I have been exchanging for months with a man who calls himself El Professor. He is so intelligent, he seems to always know what I am going to say before I even say it! And now he is coming in the city! I promised I would make him visit the bank. Could you pick him up?
Thank you! He loved the bank, he said he will visit it with friends of his soon!
People who keep exotic pets, and fail to care for them, seldom realise the damage they do to native animal populations! We must catch the invaders before they take hold!
Could you take the photograph, at the front of the University? My daughter has studied eleven hours each day, for five years for this moment!
Because I am a woman, many question if the breakthrough really is mine. As such, it gives me the greatest pleasure to be photographed beside the steam shipyard where my new engine will be used.
The workers presume I am too fancy to get my hands dirty. But I value field work greatly! A photograph of me visiting the steelworks shall prove it!
I wonder what would happen if we tried to photograph a train in motion? Exposure will likely make it a blur, a smudge, but why don't we conduct a little test!
I am hosting an academic symposium for my co-authors, and need to feed them all. Experts say fish is good for the brain— please deliver some to my home.
Seems we have no time to cook the fish, in part because we can't reach consensus on the best method. Perhaps you could bring some of the tinned stuff instead?
My sand-themed paper cannot propound a single unifying theory without the support of experimental evidence! I will need materials!
With so much still to be discover, we cannot afford to rest! If recent healthfulness researches are to be believed, my colleagues and I have little to fear from our coffee indulgences!
We are presently trying to teach chimps and bonobos to perform human tasks, and would like a fleet of bicycles to wheel them to the park on. Would you be able to help?

Most people still fear the light bulb! Think they'll be electrocuted if they touch one! Well, let's bring them out of the dark ages. Help me organise an eastern festival of light, with an undercurrent of education!
People of the New World worship me. Hmmn...
Everywhere I go, people seem to look through me. Hmmn...
An imperfect sphere, white with light, I grow in darkness, the lady's delight. Hmmn, what is it?
Break a piece of me off, and I can provide shade. What am I?

When they are green and when they are brown, their bendy mien will cause me to frown. But split in between, for a very short while, they're joyfully yellow and cause me to smile!

What am I?
I'm fastest on a full belly, and it sounds like I'm going cheap. What am I?

I stop, it keeps running.
What it it?
As the holding company, about time you received some additional benefits, eh? Take some surplus product!
An associate has bailed on me at the crucial moment. Perhaps you want these gramophones, at a fraction of the usual price?
I brought this back from the last trip, but it really does not befit our mantelshelf as I thought it would. Please, you keep it!
Productivity— keyword of our time! Use this machine! It will never ask a wage, be indolent, or show up late!
The exhibition opening has been a ripping success! Cause for celebration— one I should be honoured to sponsor!
I'm always looking to gain an advantage over the competition! Convince them to back-off, and I predict the markets will pick-up.
Wood flammable? Hmmn, yes I suppose that is a safety risk, maybe I will invest elsewhere...
You're right, I am stressed. And a holiday might keep the whole family quiet for a while...
Involved in shady dealings you say? Then I owe you my thanks, and shall withdraw from the deal immediately!
I wish to form an investment consortium— and what with so many affluent visitors in the city...any chance you might 'hook us up'?
Oh no, I'm terribly sorry, we blew all of our family fortune on this holiday...
With a fellow notorious for his disreputable business practices? Never!
That sounds a lucrative proposition indeed! I shall accept forthwith!
Never mind if Christmas is coming, he shall not have a day off! Where is the fool anyway? Made destitute by his thriftless present-giving perhaps?!
Mr Scrounge may seem miserly, but I am certain a candle of charity burns yet in his heart. I shall wish him greetings of the season as I would any other!
Bah! Humbug! What reason has he for being so merry?! I am by far the richer, and yet I find that season abhorrent!
If we are to drag this place out of the mire, we need talent. Talent I say! If only we could prise some quality away from Sir Archibald's offices of state...
Dashed sorry old chap, but I'm a royalist through and through!
For some upstart business nonsense? Are you mad? I work for the Queen!
Yes! I will join you. After all, I have always been royally undervalued here...
That dratted boy delivered yesterday's news! I urgently need to check the price of Oats, bring me today's edition!
He was cavorting through the streets in his underwear! Goodness knows how he arrived at such a state of undress, but he must be stopped!
Poor, gentle Nelson, he can't have gone far! Perhaps he is pawing at sooty miner's ropes again!
Every impecunious old family seems to be courting my riches with offers of marriage. A few snaps will ensure I'll get more than just a title—if you know what I mean...
A solid, industrious frame, but too ancient! No, this old family factory is a lost cause!
Ugh! What tired and tumbledown features! I see no prospects here.
Oh yes, wowzer! I think we've hit the jackpot. That factory looks ideally situated.
Mister Jenkins is the one, I'm sure of it! I pursued him by foot as far as the docks— what business can he have there but to be trading my secrets to mafiosi!
All they do is complain about being poor! What of hard work? If I did it from nothing, so can they, a photograph of me can prove it!
I am smiling for the first time in decades! You must take a photograph! The spirits have shown me the way— oh what a fool I was! I shall give my employee and his family a Christmas to remember!
A statue of me will galvanize the layabouts of this city into action! Productivity will soar, and so will profits!
What do you take me for? Think I want to mix with the plebeians in a grotty tavern? No! I want membership of an elite club, and to garner social influence!
This week has me bored stiff, and I don't have time to work out how to relax. Entertain me! Spoil me with the novel, the exotic, the exquisite!
Are you quite mad, sirrah? Who doesn't already have a gramophone?!
I'm the one who needs to blow off steam! I don't need an engine to do it for me!
Well no surprise in the end, but ever a winner. You know me well! Gold is the one thing I shall never tire of.
These charity gala are crucial to do business but annoyingly I need to give to charity to attend. Deliver supplies to "Indigent order" on my behalf, you would be sweet.
Fine, they were happy with the delivery. You don't mind me saying I paid for these right?
Everyone who's anyone will be at this party, Better make sure the horses get their apples— and this is a whole herd of prime mustang we're talking about!
I'm trying to corner the executive lunch rush with these corn flaps from across the water, but I'm going to need a bally sample batch...
My darling granddaughter is the only one capable of bringing tears to my eyes. I only hope showering her with gifts will make up for any difficulty I have expressing these feelings.
Eh, you know what this is? I went for a walk in the mountains and found my paca nibbling on it. Go on, take it, it's not like I need it.

I am getting old, I wish to transmit my knowledge to young lads so they can learn some craft. Could you find enthousiastic and industrious youngster? I can teach them everything I know about wood cutting!
No way, I will go to the Old World when I grow up!
This is my chance!
There is no future in wood cutting, if only I could learn about electricity instead!
Nan.
Sure ...

I ... I have asked my grand son to help me write a letter for a lady I used to know, back on El Puerto island. Would you be kind enough to deliver it to her? After all these years of silence I don't dare looking at her.
What did they say? No no don't tell me, I just hope she understands.
The alpacas are loose, master! No no no, how could this happen!? Help this old man gather his flock back, por favor!
This weather, boss... I swear I never saw animals behave like this. Los cocodrilos, for example, are getting dangerously close to town. Something must be done before a kid gets hurt...
Pearl-diving has always been a dangerous job, trust me, I've been doing it since I was a muchacho. But we never had as many problems with the sharks as we do now. Think you can chase them away?
My nieto, Miguel, said he was going to visit his abuelita for El Día de los Muertos. But boss, my Antonia passed away years ago! And Miguel still hasn't returned...
Ever since my nieta María fed and sheltered that crook Bill, she keeps mumbling something about a grotto in the pirate island. Hell if I know what you will find there...
Well, here we are. Didn't your editor want a picture of us "busy bees of the New World"? To think people waste their time with this petty distractions...
My bones get heavier and heavier with each passing day... I would like to have my picture taken. You know, for the family altar, but... We are very poor, boss. You have a picture machine, sí...?

When I was a young boy my father took me sailing with him every day. The sea mist, the sails in the wind... I miss it all as much as I miss him.If I had but a picture to bring back all these memories with my pa...
No wonder our youths have completely forsaken our values when we don't have a church to spread the gospel truth!
My cousin Pablo lost his home to the flames. They have nowhere to stay... If you could only build a new house for them, our entire familia would be forever grateful, boss.
Nothing brings us jornaleros as much joy as stroking a sweet guitar. I used to be a luthier back in the day, if you bring me wood, I can make one for everyone.
My grandkids keep pestering me to play with them. And I'm not the only one, kids here seem to be utterly bored. With some alpaca wool I could make plush toys for them.
I remember my mamá cooking for the whole neighbourhood, spreading joy with her homemade fried plantains. I would like to honour her memory doing the same, if you can spare some bananas and oil.

There are rumours of a child striving to survive in the wilderness! People say a bear and a panther look after him, but those are no conditions to live in! Could you find him for me? I will take good care of the poor thing.

A gang of horribly corrupter police officers are extorting the good people of this town and beating people up when they refuse to comply. They have threatened me too, but not speaking up against injustice is against my nature!
The jornaleros at the corn field, they are so hard-working... Too much for their own good! They need to take their legally required break! They won't listen to us, but I know they'll listen to you.
Help! My friends has been abducted by La Fortune's brutes! She must be somewhere on his island! Please, I beg of you, bring her back!
The war has left many orphans behind... I am committed to doing as much good as I can in the world. If you see a child on the streets, will you send them to me? I will look after them.
Gratitude is so often taken for granted... We have decided to give good when good is due. I know it's a small thing, but we wanted to celebrate everything you've done for us with a present.
Our family gathers every week to have a lunch together, but and there's always so much food left over! I hate to see it all go to waste. Please, take it and share it with the ones in need.

The bridge you have set between our continents is unprecedented! I have learned so much from your Old World, I would love to contribute to spread the knowledge about our culture there as well! Could you take this and set it on display?

Nana Angustias passed away and left me her wedding necklace. But I don't need it, really. I know it's worth something, I'm sure you can put it to good use and help the less fortunate... I know it is what she would have wanted as well.

Today marks the first year anniversary of the rise of our revolution. Your editor wants to feature us freedom fighters in a commemorative article, and since you have been such an inspiration for us it would mean a lot if you could take the snapshot.

We are all so proud of all the exemplary improvements you have done here, as should you! Wouldn't it be perfect to celebrate this town with a feature article in your newspaper? It may encourage more people to emigrate to join us!

Our society has come such a long way in the past few years! Now a woman can have her own income and independence without it being frowned upon. We obreras want to be an example for generations to come, could you showcase a picture of us humble factory workers in your newspaper?

We are lucky enough to be living times of peace, but many of my comrades are still fighting against the grip of La Corona. They require weapons, but it would be too risky for you to smuggle them yourself. If you entrust me with the supplies, I could sent them to my comrades through our underground network!

Many of our comrades are still fighting against La Corona, but their supplies are running low and hunger is starting to wear them down... If you can spare some bread, I can make sure it makes their way to them.

Most can't imagine how cold nights can get in the open, even if it's warm in daylight. I will never forget the freezing nights when we were running from La Corona. If you can spare some alpaca wool, I can make blankets to send the refugees.
It is a real shame that children here have to be home schooled. The experience of sharing knowledge is lost on us. If only we had a museum, we could turn it into a shrine of culture.
We have fought long and hard to be rid of tyranny, now is the time for democracy! We need to elect our own representatives, and they can only work from a town hall.
Oh could you use a machine in one of our factories? I would love to see modernity in the making!
Ah, the classics of literature! I abhor the thought of people going about their whole lives without ever reading a page. We need to spark the love for the written word! How about a book exhibition?
There are still so many war refugees knocking at our doors, Gobernor. If you were to house them, I am sure they would be more than happy to join our flourishing community!

You have a beautiful city I am sure! But visiting it empty stomached would only make it fade. When appetite goes, everything goes and I sure have a strong appetite! Your city is famous far and wide for the quality of its meat, please give me some!

Wonderful! My brain functions better when I am full. You see I am an expert in content creation, my newspaper back home is very popular. I could help you get more subscribers to your newspaper as well! Simply take a picture of your amazing pig farm, write a witty article about it and the likes will pour!

A deal well made! You know what, I feel we could get along the two of us; you understand my love for food and follow my advices. I feel so much at ease here that I have invited my whole group of friends. They told me they would wait for me at the pub. If you help me find them I am your man!
Delicious but nobody can be full with fishes only! More!
Delicious wurst, but don't you have beef? It is more tender!
What about the little toast of bread to make all of that slip?
A farmer's aunt has passed away, leaving her niece a very nice heriloom. Unfortunately, it has no practical use. She would like you to keep it instead.
This farmer's son found something buried in the dirt. She thought you would like to have it.
This farmer has had a very good harvest of potatoes. So good they have too many! She thought you could put the surplus to good use.
This fisherwoman caught a seagull feasting on her hard work. She wants to put it in your custody.
This farmer's pigs have escaped their pen and now roam the streets of your city! Help her catch them, they are all she has in the world!
The farmer's husband has a record of disappearing and drinking himself to sleep in the streets. She's worried something bad might have happened to him.
The farmer's son is a renouned scoundrel and she has lost track of him yet another time. She's worried he might be getting in trouble again and requested your help to find him.
This farmer girl has troubles finding a suitable companion to match her colourful personality. She has requested you help her find a worthy suitor.
This farmer is very close to her cow Antoinette. She is nowhere to be seen and her owner is worried sick. She has asked for your help to find her old friend.
This farmer worries the stray dogs will hurt the neighbourhood children if you do nothing to prevent it. She requests that you lock them away.
A fox is hunting the farmer's hens! She begs you to catch it before it eats them all up.
Farmer had her pigs stolen by one of the Willington's brothers. She needs help identifying which one is guilty.
The farmer's animals have escaped and she seems to believe they somehow planned it. Find them around town, they are all they have!
The farmer really wants to see the alpacas of the New World. You can take a picture of them and send it her way! She will surely be grateful.

The most curious bond is being blessed at the Church: Montanes and Capitules, lifelong enemies, are now united by the wedding between their first borns. A picture would set the memory fast in their memories, so they never go back to their old quarrels.
The Agricultural Fair is a very special event for farmers, especially this one and her cow! She has asked that you take a picture of the fair for your newspaper.
The firefighters are this farmer's son heroes. Encourage his dream of becoming a part of the squad taking his picture before the firestation.
This farmer is working very hard to provide for her family. Having a fountain nearby would really lift a heavy burden from her shoulders.
Farming tools are dangerous! A few accidents have already stemed from not storing them properly. The farmer would like to have a kiosk to safely put them away.
This farmer's father refuses to retire despite his old age. She has asked that you plant a tree near the field so he can at least get some rest from the sun.

This farmer is terribly committed to her craft and would like to learn more about agriculture in other shores. She has requested you bring bananas from the New World for her and her coleagues to taste.
Farmer would like canned food for her wedding feast.
The farmer is very worried that her family and neighbours do not have enough firewood to last the whole winter. She has asked you for some timber.
Farmer asks for help finding the mysterious man she met in the forest.
A Farmer wants to give you a quest.
A life without worries is starting to get to this worker. He even has a little something for you, who would have said!
The orphans in your town are perfectly healthy and well-fed, they wanted to thank you with a little present.
This worker's coleagues do not take their union meetings as seriously as he does. He would like your help to find them around town and make them attend.
These miners are a close gang, they go everywhere in a line. But not even that prevents them from getting lost in their way to the mines. They'll be in troble if they miss their shift again.
This worker's son is a true revolutionary! So much that he gets his father in trouble. He would like to help to find him and get him to go to bed.
This worker's coleague seems to be causing his union a lot of trouble by revolting on the wrong date. He would like you to find him and disperse his one-man protest discreetly.
This worker has had a very long day and would like to relax at Ah Sing's. He looks a bit disoriented, but you should be able to spot the place easily by the puffs coming out the windows.
Soot and smoke are an essential part of a worker's daily life, but they can always count on Miss Alethea's remedies. Provided they can climb to her house in the mountains...
This worker desperately wants everyone to know about his after-work activities. Unfortunately, the rules explicitly forbid talking about it... but not taking pictures of it.
These brick factory workers are very close pals. They have asked you to take a picture of them as a gift for their friend Jimmy.
This worker wants to protest against the investors for rejecting him at the club, and it looks like he has a peculiar method in mind. He has asked you to take a picture of the... occasion.
This worker's daughter has fallen ill due to the pollution from the factories. He asks you to build a hospital so she can be taken care of.
The workers have to mend their work clothes every day. They have asked you for sewing machines to make their lives easier.
Social inequality is a big concern for this worker. That's why he would like you to bring some chocolate for them!
This worker just had a baby girl! They want to toast to her with something classier than a pint of ale, but they cannot afford champagne with their salary...
The worker would like to organise a barbacue to bring the neighbourhood together. He has requested you provide the sausages and bread.
Looks like this worker is the sad winner of a very destructive competition. He has asked that you lend him some bricks to fix the results of his victory.
A Worker wants to give you a quest.
An Artisan begs you to supply some fine woollen ponchos.
The Artisans find it hard to concentrate on anything without freshly-milled coffee, and hope you may be able to supply it.
An Artisan would like you to supply his touring piratical musical with rum enough for its entire run of shows.
An Artisan hopes you might supply him with sails for some sort of as-yet-undefined art fair-cum-maritime forum he has spontaneously conceived.

A wistful Artisan believes he is ready to take up the plough, and leave the city behind. He hopes you might find a farming family willing to take him on until he is confident enough to instruct himself.
An Artisan has come to you asking to meet the renowned composer who is passing through the city. Perhaps something can be arranged.
An Artisan's daughter has gallivanted off into the hills. Much as it pains him, he needs someone to bring her back home to help in his workshop.
An Artisan comes to you with news his cousin, a notable pastry chef, has wandered off. If he knew where he was, such a suggestible soul might easily be convinced to work for you!
An Artisan comes to you, anxious you may have overlooked the presence of an acclaimed tragic actor in your city. Massaging the thespian's fragile ego with a welcome may prove mutually beneficial!
An Artisan was too caught in his own dreamworld to keep track of his apprentice, who, having once again shirked his duties, must be found.
Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...!
Forget it! We've had them dandies beofre. By noon he'll be slumped over the plough, broken and a-weepin'.
He'll only be a burden! Met one once who didn't like the 'texture of dust'. Can you imagine?!
He'll work for bed and board? Alright, send him along— we can always turf him out! Haha.
Artisan wants a picture of your New World island.
An Artisan would like a photograph of his daughter's first day at school, so that she might one day see how her journey to enlightenment began.
An Artisan would like to be photographed alongside his extensive family on the special occasion of their visit to the Zoological gardens.
An Artisan would like the opening of his cannery photographed, so that his scions may remember the day with pride.
An Artisan would like you to photograph a fistfight between him and a rival for the affections of Rebecca, his apparently unrequited love.
An Artisan has seen all there is to see at your museum and hopes a new exhibition will be opened soon.
An Artisan offers you a book he imagines you might enjoy.
An Artisan would like to present you ceremonial arms once belonging to warriors of antiquity, discovered during a recent amateur excavation.
An Artisan has been moved to present you a personal masterwork of his own creation!
Artisan advice you to visit the Annual Artisan Fair.
Artisan would like you to choose who is the best poet.
An Artisan wants to give you a quest.
An Engineer would like to you to test her latest invention.
An Engineer is offering you seeds to help grow non-native crops on one of your islands.
An Engineer recommends you enlist the services of her colleague; a doctor determined to improve living conditions in your city.
Engineer would like to teach to Workers' children to grant them a better life.
Engineer would like you to meet with El Professor, a man who whishes to visit the city bank.
Engineer would like you to help Charles Darwin to conduct his study on evolution.
Engineer would like you to stop the Shelley couple from pulling pranks on gullible town people.
An Engineer would like you to find the exotic animals wandering your island, as she worries they may damage local species.
An emotional Engineer would like you to photograph her daughter at her University on graduation day.
An Engineer would like to have her photograph taken to revel in her success as a naval engine-builder.
Engineer would like to have her picture taken in front of the steelworks.
An Engineer would like you to attempt to photograph a train in movement.
An Engineer wants plenty of tallow and quartz sand for her latest experiment.
An Engineer would like her department supplied with Coffee.
An Engineer would like to cater for her academic peers since she is hosting a forum for scientific researches.
An Engineer would like to commission a fleet of Penny Farthings for the institute of primate research.
An Engineer would like to prove to people the benefit of electric lighting by arranging the new-fangled bulbs in a public display.
An Engineer would like you to solve her enigma.
Engineer would like you to solve her enigma.
An Engineer wants to give you a quest.
An investor would like to give you a gift for all your support.
An Investor would like to sell you a fleet of spangly gramophonographs for a discounted price of 100 000 credits.
An Investor wants to give you a souvenir from his travels he has no interest in anymore.
An Investor would like to offer you a machine to improve factory efficiency.
Delighted by its success, an Investor would like to sponsor the after-party of your grand exhibition with some luxury goodies.
The investor was hoping to keep up with the latest market fluctuations, but unfortunately has been delivered yesterday's newspaper. Deliver him today's paper instead.
The Investor has sighted a lewd interloper revealing himself in public in the neighbourhood. You had better catch him, or all these repressed prudes may start doing it!
My poor lost kitten, she shall be so sad without me, all alone out there, only those copper miners for playthings!
Investor would like you to convince his competitors to leave the business.
An investor is looking for a business partner, and thinks the influx of visiting wealth in the city might be a good chance to hook-up with like-minded entrepreneurs.
Mr Scrounge would like you to find his employee, so that he can inform him he will be working through Christmas.
An investor has come to you bemoaning the dearth of talent in the city. He comes to you asking you to scout around in Sir Archibald's circles.
An investor believes his employee Mr Jenkins to be divulging industrial secrets to a nefarious third party, and wishes for photographic proof of the underhand dealings before taking action.
A wealthy investor would like his photograph taken, believing his rags-to-riches story the perfect example for those in poverty.
A wealthy investor would like photographic previews of his marriage offers, in order to decide which noble bloodline to marry into.
Investor would like a picture of him and his employee's family celebrating Christmas.
An investor would like you to pay homage to his industriousness with a statue in his likeness. He believes his example can be an inspiration to others.
The investor is sick of having to look at poor people when he comes into town, and would like you to build a club so he can shoot billiards with his public school chums.
An Investor wants an avalanche of champagne and cigars for a monumental house party.
An investor would like to experience the most marvellous indulgences the world has to offer, pamper him with luxury!
An investor hopes to bring tortilla to the old world masses. But he needs some samples to see if they'll prove a hit.
An Investor seeks a fitting gift for his granddaughter's birthday, but feels completely out of touch. Can you help him?
Investor would like you to give supplies to a charity on his behalf.
An Investor wants to give you a quest.
Jornalero would like you to listen to the story of his life.
This jornalero was taking his usual walk in the mountains when his alpaca found something curious...

This jornalero is very worried about his granchild Miguel, who has not returned home. The last time they saw him, he said he was off to visit his deceased grandmother. Maybe a place of mourning is the best place to start looking.
Jornalero would like to pass on his knowledge to kids.
The alpacas have escaped their pen and now run wild all around town! Help the jornalero gather them back before someone is hurt.
Climate changes have affected the behaviour of the wildlife. This jornalero is very concerned about some crocodiles that lurk not far from the city.
Some sharks are terrorising the pearl divers and making their job more dangerous than it already is. They have asked you to take care of the pest.
Jornalero hope you can give a letter to a woman he once knew.
This jornalero granddaughter helped a criminal, and it would seem like, in exchange, he had a secret for her. It has to do with a grotto in a pirate island. What could it be...?
Your editor wants to feature the hard working jornaleros for the next edition of the newspaper and has asked them to pose for you. Take the snapshot whenever you are ready.
This jornalero would like to have a picture for their family to leave at his altar once he is gone, but he cannot afford a photographer. He has kindly asked you to do it for him.
This jornalero has asked you to take a picture of a sail ship, as it would remind him of his childhood sailing with his father.
The depravity of the newer generations! This jornalero would like you to preserve their traditional principles by building a church.
Pablo's home was burnt in the last fire. His cousin has asked you to build a new house for him and his family.
This jornalero would like to bring his share of happiness to the community by building guitars for everyone. He only needs the wood to make them.
As annoying as playing with his grandchildren might be for this jornalero, he still has a soft side. He would like you to bring him some alpaca wool to make plush toys for all the children in town.
This jornalero would like to cook for the whole neighbourhood as his mother used to do in her memory.
A Jornalero wants to give you a quest.

Rumour has it that there is a child living in the jungle only with a bear and a panther for company. This obrera has asked you to find him and bring him to her so she can take proper care of the child.
An obrera has informed you about a case of police corruption in your town. You should find the crooked officers and end the situation at once. According to what you've heard, they are quite violent.

The jornaleros who work at the corn field are working so hard it is becoming a threat to their health! An obrera is worried about them and has asked you to go there and reassure them that it is not only ok but required that they take a small break every once in a while.
This obrera is very worried about her missing friend. Apparently, she has been kidnapped by La Fortune's pirates. She has asked you to find her at his island.
This obrera is worried about the orphans in the streets. She would like to take care of as many as she can. If you see any homeless children, you can tell them to go to her.
The obreros are so thankful to you for fulfilling their dreams of a better world that they would like to give you a present.
This obrera has a lot of leftovers from her family's gathering and she would like to share it with those who might need it instead of throwing it all away.

This obrera is passionate about knowledge, and she would like you to teach the people overseas about the rich culture of the New World. That's why she wants grant you a relic from her native culture so that you make it part of your museum exhibitions.
This obrera's grandmother passed away and left her a beautiful necklace, but she'd rather you have it and use it to help the poor.
The editor wants to write an article about the one-year anniversary of the success of the obreras revolution, and they have asked that you take the picture for the article.
This obrera believes your town is perfect and deserves the attention of your newspaper. She has suggested you take a picture of the island to appear in the next edition of your newspaper.

Times have fortunately changed, and is completely normal for women to be employed at factories. The obreras are very proud of being part of this shift in society and would love to appear in your newspaper to set an example for future generations.

Many obreros are still fighting for the Revolution against La Corona, but they lack weapons. If you were to send them yourself, they would be intercepted and used against them, but this obrera can use her contacts to make sure they arrive at their destination.
The people of the Revolution are still fighting La Corona's yoke, but they are low on supplies and need your help. This obrera can help bring them bread if you can give it to her.

Even in the tropical weather, nights are very cold in the New World. This obrera cannot forget all the people running away from La Corona and would like to make blankets for them if you give her some alpaca wool.
This obrera believes the community would greatly benefit from having a shared place in which to share knowledge and culture. That's why she has asked you to build a museum on the island!
The obreros have reminded you that democracy demands an appointed institution. That is why they have asked you to build a town hall in the island.
Obrero would like to have a machine used in a factory.
This obrera would love to have a book exhibition at the museum to inspire her love for literature to the community.
The war with La Corona leaves many new refugees every day. This obrera has suggested you build more houses for them to move into your island.

Discovered [SessionGUID Text]!
Farmers and their families are the providers, carers; the foundation.
Workers are the real champions of industry; the resolute heroes of the factory floor.
Flamboyant individualists who aspire to create, Artisans live for the fine detail of their craft.
Engineers crest the wave of progress; being bright, experimental, and above all, rational.
Investors are wealthy, and the wealthy don't work— they have others work for them.
He has weathered countless storms and steered many ships safely to harbour. Will his luck persist?
Bitten by the travel bug, nothing and no one can stop her from traveling the world.
A bright young journalist once determined to reveal truth, now struggling with the reality of his job.
Your sister Hannah, into whose lap the family business has landed. She always longed to get away and become a writer, before all this happened.
Your soulmate Aarhant, whose life you once saved. Nothing seems to satisfy him that his debt to you is repaid.
To Bente life is an exciting adventure full of thrilling discoveries and new friends waiting to be made.

He is a strict and efficient prison guard despite he always wished to enter the royal marina. He is actively looking for wanted pirates and outlaws of the crown. He is deeply loyal to the Queen and to the Commonwealth.

Can't be reproduced, but will do for some time.
What didn't grow before, now does.
Bred for faster growth.
The finest breed since 1404.
The gift of Kukulkan.
A bloody but efficient way of catching prey.
Takes over ships for a living.
Looks important and allows you to do things. Useful on expeditions.
The Royal Supply ship's freight list, to be handed over to the Queen.
Better than no sails, I guess?
Once shattered they were still useful to scribes in training.
A single beetle amulet was put within mummies to guard their journey.
The verdict is still out on whether cats are pets or gods or both.
How manifold it is, what thou hast made!
With a guardian this large, one can be glad it's made of stone.
Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!
Someone else's final resting place, now empty.
The journey of the dead described here is even longer than this books' journey.
Ancient ruler with striking red hair.
Not demanding anymore crackers.
Someone decided this bird should live on forever.
The necklace made of primate canines exudes a certain mysterious aura.
The vivid colours woven in lush flora patterns adorned the walls of a distant king's chambers.
These rags might have been lush garments before the passing of centuries weathered them away.
The original owner of this ornate helmet is unknown, but the plated wings on the temples are reminiscent of the mythological Northen riders that decided who lived and died in the battlefield.
The contents have since been stolen.
Unidentifiable from all the fungi growing on it.
The extraordinarily well preserved frozen body of an Andes girl wrapped in a bundle of clothes. It is believed she was offered as a sacrifice to the gods.
This beaded piece of jewelery belonged to Pakal Sun Shield, the deified monarch that reigned for over half a century.
This specimen has revolutionised the recent conversations about evolution and is taken as scientific proof that mankind was once a close relative to the apes.
These human remains have been prooved to belong to Hayreddin Barbarossa, the actually black-bearded King of Pirates that rose to the rank of Admiral of the Osman Empire.
Two of the three heads seem odd…
Very novel for its time.
An illustrious book with golden letters and colorful flourishes.
The fabled collection of poems that gave the modern anthropologists a window into the life and mythology of the Northen people.
Illustrations spanning hundreds of metres transcribed on pebbles.
Centuries old bookkeeping records from a remote trading post.
The collection of sagas that retells the life and feats of the old Northen kings.
This magnificent copy of Humerus' epic poem about the feats and tribulations of Aquiles dates from the 4th century. It provides an invaluable insight on Aegean mythology, daily life and traditions.
The first manuscripted copy of the epic poem by Humerus, engraved with gold. The grandious adventure was for many centuries considered to have taken place in reality.

This ancient cyclical calendar system consists of a series of disks that allowed people to keep track of very long periods of time. It seems to suggest time will come to an end in about two more centuries...
Geometric cubes intertwined in each other.
This god's gem allegedly controls the winds.
The imperial gem par excellence, the bright green radiance of its polished surface brings a curious ease to its beholder.
The fabled weapon capable of leveling mountains.
A delicate hammer that produced many famous jewellery pieces.
The humble token of an ancient family.
According to Northen mythology, this ring that could grant its bearer the power to rule the Earth caused the fall of the Old Gods.
What is left of a very modest ring. The bright coloured paint has completely worn off now.
The last abode of the forgotten Andes empire. Powerful spirits dwell in these ruins.
The intricate carvings on this residence reveal previously unknown details of the stunning architecture of the Lost Cities.
A former jade and turquoise trading sea port, Tulum was once a thriving landmark of the Lost Cities.
Also known as the Temple of the Great Jaguar, this breathtaking sacred place used in rituals and sacrifices was considered a gate to Xibalba, the underworld.
The advanced writing system of the Lost Cities continues to baffle researchers to this day.
The king of the carnivores, the sight of its breathtaking skeleton alone is enough to leave the bravest man in complete awe.
Researchers still debate if the characteristic triangular plates laid flat on its back, as a giant tortoise, of if they in fact ran vertically along its spine.
One of the most colossal creatures to ever wander the Earth, the sheer size of this towering herbivore has physiologists puzzled as to how they could hold up their own weight.
Even its discoverers struggled to believe that such a gargantuan sea creature once roamed the oceans cassually snacking on sharks.
These very early paintings of bisons in charcoal and ochre are in such an exquisite state of conservation some skeptics have labelled the discovery as fraud.
The depiction of the first hunts of our ancestors.
The last remnants of the legendary temple, walking amid the awe-inspiring columns truly transports one to Aegean times.
The best preserved of the major monuments of the Aegean Golden Age, the breathtaking majesty of this temple seems to reach out for a long forgotten deity.
These remnants are imbued with an otherworldly energy. Stories suggest the sanctuary was erected atop a Ferrous Age place of worship.
The last vestiges of the once beating heart of the Eagle Empire, these remnants belong to one of the many wings annexed by a long running chain of glorious emperors.
The intricate design of this mosaic depicts an epic battle scene between Eagle Empire armies against their Parthian enemies.
The exquisite tesellation remains almost untouched. Contemplating its concentric pattern makes one feel as lightheaded as spending an evening with Dionysus.
Nobody to this day has understood the true significance or purpose of this giant megalithical monument, but a mystical, celestial energy resonates between its crown-arranged menhirs.
The bewildering structure seems to signal a burial place where purifying funeral rituals took place.
The Altar of the legendary Northen temple, where nine males of every living creatures were offered to the gods as sacrifices to stop famine and war.
These intricate interlace patterns carved in stone were one of the most iconic trademarks of the Goidelic culture.
A regular copy of the collection of stories about the medieval customs of the Old World.
It wasn't worth much in its time, but retains some historical value.
Not an uncommon stone, but dazzling all the same.
The dent on its temple hints at the fate of its original owner.
Its bearer was not high-born, but this shield withstood every fatal blow to protect them.
Although many parts are missing, anthropologists believe it represents an old heathen deity.
Rust has nearly eaten the whole of the blade by now.
The vast treasure the leader of the corsairs hoarded throught his many years in the piracy business.
Claims about its authenticity are flimsy, but if it is what it is said to be…
An extraordinarily large, flawless piece, its glare is otherworldly.
This lavish armour piece bathed in gold and engraved with war scenes is said to have belonged to a remarkable general.
The researchers that stumbled upon these egg fossils initially misstook them for those of a giant bird.
This ring made up of a solid piece of 22 carat gold was specially tailored for an ancient queen's hand.
Whomever wielded this blade made sure it stated their status having its guard embroidered with noble filigrees and stones.
The mythical treasure of the generous Goidelic ruler, legends say when drawn by a worthy person, the entire blade would blaze with fire.
This treatise verses on the Art of Medicine, specifically anatomy and phisiology.
The lower classes would live their whole life without ever catching a glimpse of their golden glimmer.
The common soldier's protection.
The pinnacle of early Goidelic metalworking, its gilt silver filigrees weave the captivating swirling motifs characteristic of the Goidelic culture.
The fossilised spiral shells of a long-lost species of marine molluscs.
Simple but effective jewellery.
Some quality protection for those who went to war.
The godlike proportions of the Aegean deity were finely sculpted in Parian marble.
Elementary weapon that could resist a pair of battles.
Enough to buy some slaves in the past time.
The colors are still vivid thanks to the dry environment.
More like a useless ornament than a protection.
The pendant did not very well survive to the time.
Corroded due to the humid environment in which it was let.
and, as the hero brandished his sword toward the sun…'
Rather let it down than take it in combat.
Must have been nice hundreds of years ago.
Can be dangerous for unshielded warriors.
The exact significance of these tall-standing stones puzzles anthropologists, but evidence suggests they are often tied to religious landmarks.
This finely carved piece represents every detail of the old vessels preceded by dragon prows with which the Northern sailed the oceans.
Watch out for your finger food.
ara macao
The local predator.
Looks also good over the chimney.
Cute only when young.
Tursiops truncatus
Don't underestimate these killers.
King of the jungle, but far away from his kingdom.
Jelly source of irritation.
Alltogether, better than Picasso's paintings.
Underestimated predator by virtue of his cuteness.
A small version of dinosaurs.
A highly concentrated dose of poison.
A true ocean ballet when gathered.
The smallest birds ever.
Hypnotizes you before your death.
Dante's vision of hell in one bucket.
A marvel of natural design.
Don't mistake its fin for a shark's.
Can also serve for ball games.
Darwin's abyssal mistake.
Not that slow in the ocean.
Nom nom nom.
The legendary cat, trophy of tribal warriors.
"Look, Dad ! A huge tree trunk!" *banging noise*
If it's a cat, you're the mouse, now.
Worth the five men it took to catch.
inia geoffrensis
The emblem of the old empires.
The modern invader of modern cities.
Very common but very cute.
Not going to deliver anything anymore.
Can't be seen in the dark.
Men's best friend.
Carrier of goods and people.
Basically a sheep without the fluff.
A horse without a rider is still a horse, a rider without a horse is just a man.
For those who don't like farming machines.
Much brighter and cleaner than you think.
So fluffy!
Revered by almost everyone.
Likes hens and roosters.
Devourer of the dead.
