The Pyrphorian fire will burn bright and long at the quayside this night. Only one of your crew return home.
Find some way to sneak inside

Your crew stalk noiselessly around the back. Scaling the wall they find an open window obscured by a heavy carmine drape. Peering beyond it, they see a workshop for the production of devotional sculptures, its tables now flipped into barricades. With the cultists' attentions fixed on the main door, you are able to ambush them before it turns into a gunfight, but that doesn't stop two of your own being shot dead. Having honoured the dead, your survivors conduct a search. There is no contract, but a fiery oculus stares up from the floor, it is a Pyrphorian paper tract— an invitation to a rally at the Casado estate.

They thought they had been quiet as church mice, but rounding the corner at the back of the warehouse, they have a nasty shock. Upon the balcony above, where you might have thought to gain entry to the warehouse, stands a single Pyrphorian clad in heavy garb, in his hands a long brass pipe from the aperture of which erupts a searing cone of fire. Your people spread and dive for the sea, and the Pyrphorians torch your ship. Only one of your crew return home.
Fan through the city, looking for clues.

Your scouts pick up the scent immediately. "We recognised them as the fugitives from the boat we pursued, and followed them through Montoya to its outskirts. Up in the valley there is a sizeable house on a large estate. They must have taken the contract there." You set off at once.

It seems the Pyrphorians have split. One you trace as far as the church, the other to a house of ill-repute— alternate refuges of the typical criminal. In neither case are the Pyrphorians still in evidence - you will have to ask one of the respective proprietors.
Go to the church and ask the Priest for help

None better than the priest, hidden in shadow, witness to every confession, to guide you. "Yes, the rogues were here, but they are gone now, I am powerless to stop them, like everyone else." He tells how darkness grips the Montoyan community, and their suffering pours always through his doors— a last refuge for the holy. "Many speak of a ranch, the one a little way up the valley, and a beacon, some infernal eye, that holds their wicked congregation rapt," he says. You realise if that contract is anywhere, it is probably there.

Your crew must trust themselves to the man of god. After all, he seems devoted to helping you cleanse Montoya of heresy. "No, I have not seen them," he begins, "but many of my flock have lately confessed their fears— their lost faith." He smiles blithely, and leads you from the church to a decrepit warehouse on the dock. "If you too wish to rid yourself of your demons, I encourage yout to begin here." Now forgive me, for I cannot abide violence," he says, taking his leave. You can try to break the warehouse door, or you can sneak around the back.
Go to the den of ill-repute and ask the Madam for help

The Madam is only too happy to help following such charming propitiations. "Yes, the devils were here. They always are." She leads you through a lanterned garden of red dahlia, and points you up the valley to a ranch. "The sort of eye you seek is up there, at the casona," she clutches her wrist suddenly, "searing, burning— The oculus." Lifting her hand she reveals a grotesque brand on her skin. Mildly troubled, you set out for the ranch.
The Madam refuses to help without payment. Time is money, and your mumbling mummers are wasting it.
Spend some time in the establishment

All are commendably well-behaved. Your sailors make surprisingly good companions, all paying what they owe. "Now that I have some evidence as to your good character," says the Madam, "I will help you." She leads you through a lanterned garden of red dahlia, and points you up the valley to a ranch. "The sort of eye you seek is up there, at the casona," she clutches her wrist suddenly, "searing, burning— The oculus." Lifting her hand she reveals a grotesque brand on her skin. Thanking her for her hospitality, you set out for the ranch.

After an hour your sailors are all over the place, singing and carousing, one refusing to pay for services rendered. "Get them out!" screams the Madam. "But what of the information you promised?", "Out!". You have created enough of a scene. Fortunately two boys waiting outside cheerily agree to help you for a bit of coin. They lead your band to a warehouse from they claim eerie sounds emanate at night, in their words, like "stakes being driven through the hearts of vampyrs." The door to the warehouse looks breakable.
Threaten her

"Alright, Alright," she says bitterly, "Yes, the devils were here. They always are." She leads you through a lanterned garden of red dahlia, and points you up the valley to a ranch. "The sort of eye you seek is up there, at the casona," she clutches her wrist suddenly, "searing, burning... the oculus." Lifting her hand she reveals a brand on her skin. Feeling vaguely guilty for adding to the poor woman's woes, you set out for the ranch.

She becomes strangely compliant, as if she is used to empty aggression. "This way," she says with forced sensuality. She takes you backwards over your own steps to the dock, and gestures a silked sleeve (from which no hand protrudes) to a decrepit-looking warehouse. "There. I must leave you now." The warehouse door looks breakable.

There is no sign of the Pyrphorians, at least not that any of your twits see. Giving up their search, they begin stopping locals in the street. Most shake them off and walk on in a hurry. But they finally seem to strike lucky when two boys cheerily agree to help for a bit of coin. They lead your band to a warehouse from which they claim eerie sounds emanate at night, in their words, like "stakes being driven through the hearts of vampyrs." The door to the warehouse looks breakable.
The House of Pyr

The Prosperity contract must be here. The Casona looks quite modern, with its white walls and pleasant gables. There is even an adjoining orangery, that extends naturally towards the neat parterres of its sweet-smelling garden. An arc of white gravel serves as a drive, and long lines of equally white picket border the whole acreage in typical colonial style. Indeed were it not for the unusual height of this perimeter, and the shelters abutting it at intervals— armed guards no doubt stationed in each— it would appear as any other estate. You consider your plan of entry.
Play it bold, launching an assault on the house

The guards at the main gate are efficiently dispatched, and their keys are taken. Your brigade flood into the ranch in formation, taking cover behind hedge and shrubbery, as the scattered enemy attempts to muster. Sure enough the robes begin to flow, and the petit pistols are out.
Persist with a frontal assault

The Pyrphorian defence is short-lived, and your lose no-one. Leaving the dying Pyrphorians to bask in last light, you enter the house by the front door.
Your party meet with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

Not as easy as your brigade presumes. There is strong resistance from the enemy, who in spite of their numinous attire, are well-armed. You lose good people on the way to the front door.
Your party meet with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.
Keep the combat at range

The Pyrphorians are soon down, having themselves but hand pistols, and your crack shots to contend with. Leaving the dying Pyrphorians to bask in last light, you enter the house by the front door.
Your party meet with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

The Pyrphorians are too agile for your marksmen. This is all more drawn out now than it needed to be. You lose good people on the way to the front door.
Your party meet with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

The guards at the main gate prove challenge enough already. Finally getting the better of them, your brigade see horses flood through the garden from the stables. Some are masked, others hired hands equipped with bandoliers. Even the gardeners have downed tools and pulled pistols. This is going to be rougher than you thought.
Draw the enemy out, so you can flank them

Marathon battle style. It works, the guards are defeated. A few sailors are injured but now the road to the house is open.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Your strategy is too clever for your forces, who despite outnumbering the Pyrphorians three-to-one, are marginal victors. With a war at stake, you must hurry on to the house.
Your party meet with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.
Get behind the senior officer and charge!

There's no keeping your lot down! "We are dragon-slayers", they cry, pulling the enemy from their saddles, until the clamour is suddenly over. You will bury your dead later.
Your party meet with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

The officer commands no such following, and charges alone to an early grave. After that it is a hard fight, but you scrape it. Your hurry through the violated garden to the house.
Your party meet with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.
Play it sneaky, have your best person go in alone

Your able scout climbs the fence, darting nimbly between flowerbeds, and under the broad umbrella of a royal poinciana, red as blood. The kitchen door on the east side is unguarded, but locked, what will you have them do?
Knock through the glass with a sword hilt to turn the handle

A hole punched with minimal fuss, and the door is open.
Your infiltrator meets with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

The glass does not give, and the noise is alarming. Footsteps follow. Your infiltrator dives for the cover of a cactus bed. A long agonised wait follows, before the coast is clear again, and the cactus needle they have plucked serves for the lock. The door opens.
Your infiltrator meets with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.
Fashion something with which to pick the lock

There is a satisfying click. Warping the belt-buckle was inspiration. The house seems deserted.
Your infiltrator meets with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.
Much as a wet stocking seemed a fine idea, the lock will not budge. Should they risk staying longer?
Knock through the glass with a sword hilt to turn the handle

The glass does indeed break, but it feels a little desperate.
Your infiltrator meets with no resistance in the vestibule, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

The glass does not entirely give, and the noise echoes across the yard. Footsteps come from both sides, and your infiltrator is caught. With little time now before the contract is moved on by foot or horseback, the rest of your brigade open fire. Cloaked figures on horseback flood into the garden from the stables. Even the gardeners have downed tools and pulled pistols. This is going to be rough.
Be safe, leave quickly
Running, your not-so-crafty agent finds themselves in an exposed part of the garden. If they dwell any longer they'll be caught. What would you have them do?

There's some progress at first; the fence is climbed, the house draws near. But the weakness of your scout's chosen route suddenly becomes apparent. They find themselves in an exposed part of the garden, if they dwell any longer they'll be caught. What would you have them do?
Target the nearest guard

Your scout strangles the guard, able to keep him quiet until the end. The whole thing feels a little desperate, but the path to the door is clear.
Inside, your scout meets with no resistance, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

Your scout's attempt to strangle the guard is feeble, and he manages to scream. Footsteps come from both sides, and your infiltrator is caught. With little time now before the contract is moved on by foot or horseback, the rest of your brigade open fire. Cloaked figures on horseback flood into the garden from the stables. Even the gardeners have downed tools and pulled pistols. This is going to be rough.
Climb the nearest tree and wait for an opening

Your scout manages to climb fast enough to avoid being spotted. With a short jump they are on a balcony, and entering through an open window. Inside, your scout meets with no resistance, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.

He is spotted as he climbs, and pulled down from his perch by those in dark robes. With little time now before the contract is moved on by foot or horseback, the rest of your brigade open fire. Cloaked figures on horseback flood into the garden from the stables. Even the gardeners have downed tools and pulled pistols. This is going to be rough.
Play it crafty, send someone in dressed as one of the congregation
Everything suggests the masked guard at the gate is fooled, but then she asks for a password. "A password?" repeats your impostor in the local vernacular, "er..."
Fuego

"But of course," the masked guard says calmly. But the moment your impostor has passed the gate they are seized. With little time now before the contract is moved on by foot or horseback, the rest of your brigade open fire. Cloaked figures on horseback flood into the garden from the stables. Even the gardeners have downed tools and pulled pistols. This is going to be rough.
Diosa

"Correct." The guard sounds almost surprised. Your strides unopposed up the long tree-lined drive and right in through the main door.
Inside, your impostor meets with no resistance, only dread. It is a large open room, with stairs at either side. A series of Pre-Raphaelite panels depicting Pyr the fire mother adorn the walls. In one, she stands beneath a dark and cosmic sky, disciples at her feet, each holding a braid of her flaming hair. The most striking feature of the room however, is the dome in the centre, which from below appears at first convex, and is painted in every detail as a human eye. The Oculus. A pinprick of sunlight falls from its pupil to an ominous platform, thick with ash. You cannot find that contract soon enough.
Viaje

With little time now before the contract is moved on by foot or horseback, the rest of your brigade open fire. Cloaked figures on horseback flood into the garden from the stables. Even the gardeners have downed tools and pulled pistols. This is going to be rough.

Your agent is more like little red riding hood than Pyrphorian acolyte. The disguise is entirely unconvincing. "Who are you?" barks the guard, reaching for her pistol, "state your intention!" What should your impostor do?
Talk their way out of it
Your persuasive envoy pretends to be new to the congregation,the guard seems fooled, but then asks for a password. "A password?" repeats your impostor in the local vernacular, "er..."
Diosa

Signal the assault
Search the library

Your infiltrator has the place to themself. For a library there are very few books, and no sign of that contract under P for Prosperity, S for Sarmento, or anywhere else. The mahogany shelves are mostly home to objet d'art; cast iron animals never before seen, ornate weaponry, marble votives to Pyr, and a perfect diamond, gleaming dully. May as well pocket it, before moving on.
Search the assembly hall

Rejoice! The contract is right here, beneath the hinged cover of the lectern. Hannah will be delighted, with this in your possession, a war may be prevented, and the small trouble it has taken to obtain, be proven worthwhile. Indeed there is a further windfall within the lectern, a fine silver ring, which your infiltrator may as well pocket before they make their escape.
Search the study

Rejoice! The contract is right here waiting on the desk that dominates this sparsely-furnished room. Hannah will be delighted, with this in your possession, a war may be prevented, and the small trouble it has taken to obtain, be proven worthwhile. Indeed among the miscellaneous objects in the drawers, is a rare jade pearl, which your infiltrator may as well pocket before making their escape
Search the assembly hall

Your infiltrator has the place to themself. The large room fills with natural light from the dozen rectangular panes of the window. Four empty pews confirm this as a place of congregation, and although there is no sign of that contract among the ritual objects, a brief survey of the lectern reveals a perfect diamond behind a hinged cover. May as well pocket it, before moving on.
Search the library

Rejoice! The contract is right here upon the shelves beneath the letter P for Prosperity. As it is removed, a fine silver ring topples to the floor, which your infiltrator may as well pocket before making their escape. Hannah will be delighted, with this in your possession, a war may be prevented, and the small trouble it has taken to obtain, be proven worthwhile.

Search the study

Your infiltrator has the place to themself. The study is small and spartan, an occasional home for some absent overseer perhaps. As such you would think the most likely place for important documents, but of that contract there is no sign! Riffling through the drawers however, does produce a perfect diamond, gleaming dully. May as well pocket it, before moving on.

Hannah will be delighted, with this in your possession, a war may be prevented, and the small trouble it has taken to obtain, be proven worthwhile. Indeed there is even a further windfall, a gleaming silver shield on the wall. You may as well have the men carry it with you as you leave.
Search the assembly hall

Rejoice! The contract is right here, beneath the hinged cover of the lectern. Hannah will be delighted, with this in your possession, a war may be prevented, and the small trouble it has taken to obtain, be proven worthwhile. Indeed there is a further windfall, at the end of the hall, a curious fossil atop a pedestal. You may as well have the men carry it with you as you leave.
Search the library

Your infiltrator has the place to themself. For a library there are very few books, and no sign of that contract under P for Prosperity, S for Sarmento, or anywhere else. The mahogany shelves are mostly home to objet d'art; cast iron animals never before seen, ornate weaponry, marble votives to Pyr, and a jade pearl. May as well pocket it, before moving on.
Search the assembly hall

Rejoice! The contract is right here, beneath the hinged cover of the lectern. Hannah will be pleased. With this in your possession, a war may be prevented, and the undeniable trouble it has taken to obtain, be proven worthwhile.
Search the study

Rejoice! The contract is right here waiting on the desk that dominates this sparsely-furnished room. Hannah will be delighted, with this in your possession, a war may be prevented, and the undeniable trouble it has taken to obtain, be proven worthwhile.
Search the assembly hall

Your infiltrator has the place to themself. The large room fills with natural light from the dozen rectangular panes of the window. Four empty pews confirm this as a place of congregation, and although there is no sign of that contract among the ritual objects, a brief survey of the lectern reveals a silver ring behind a hinged cover. May as well pocket it, before moving on.

Your infiltrator has the place to themself. The study is small and spartan, an occasional home for some absent overseer perhaps. As such you would think the most likely place for important documents, but of that contract there is no sign! Riffling through the drawers however, does produce an antique gold coin May as well pocket it, before moving on.

The Investigation

Discouraged, the crew comes back to Izabel's island. "We lost them" says the captain. But a few days afterward, Izabel receives a letter: "Pyrphorian spotted in Montoya harbour. Their ship is docked but their hide is nowhere to be found." Receiving this information, the crew leaves at once.
Montoya harbour is huge, clearly a centre for commerce in the region. But it is also known to be a gathering point for all the scum and criminals who have their networks here. Finding people here will be tricky.
Convince the harbour master to give information about the Pyro ship occupants

Diplomat manage to make the crew appears as authority figures, ready to take care of the problems the ship owners cause in the city. The harbour master is relieved ship to repair the wrong they have been doing. "Every time they come here iit is a nightmare for us! I would be glad if you manage to deal with them!" He gives them the contact address written on his register. Go there.
The diplomat simply states the crew need to find the owner of the ship stationed in the harbour. The harbour master seems to have information but is scared to give them.
Bribe, money always calm nerves
Bribe
Give info, on the register an address is noted. Go there.
Cancel

The harbour master looks at the goods, clearly interested, but dismiss the proposal at once when he sees the so small amount the captain is ready to give away. "No sorry, I am not taking a risk for so little!"
Threaten him
Reassure him
He is intimidated, give the address on the register. Go there.
What an impressive display of strength! Shaking, the harbour master leads them to a house. "This it, now leave me out of it please!" and leaves at once.
He is reassured, give the address on the register. Go there.
"You are such good people, I ... I think I can trust you." He leads the crew to a house. "This is it, please do what needs to be done!" and he leaves at once in fear.

A speech for the ages! The diplomat was lyrical, impressive in his description of the madness the Pyrphorian are capable of, emotional when he states what is at stake. The harbour master is clearly moved. "Oh if only we had more people ready to stand against evil like you do! It is my pleasure to help you." He leads them to a house. "This is it, I count on you." and leaves at once, visibly frighten he could be seen by the house occupants.
Break the door open and rush in

The crew uses a bench as a ram and break the door open. They storm in, sure to find a bunch of surprised Pyrphorian. Instead, they realize they were expected. The men are strong, armed, and ready to strike. The battle is harsh but fortunately the men didn't expect for the crew to be so numerous and strong. Crew has the upper hand but suffer from several injuries. Interrogate roughly a surviving attacker and learn they are from the local mafia, allied to the Pyrphorian and charged to take care of any nosey coming around.

The sailors rush on the door at the same time, entending to break it with their shoulders. The only result is a few broken bones but a perfectly standing door. And the second attempt the door opens suddenly before they touch it, making a few sailors fall. They are immediately slained. Each sailor entering is met with a blow, clearly showing the men inside were well prepared for their arrival. The battle is unbalanced and quickly turn into a slaughter. One young sailor manages to escape while all his comrades are killed.
Sneak inside

Manage to sneak around the house discretely and enter through the back door. Once inside, while they were expecting a fairly empty house realize there is a lot of man patrolling in it, all very well armed, prepared around the front door for intruders entering. A trap! Fortunately their discretion gives the crew the upper hand and allows them to attack by surprise. The battle is harsh, the crew suffers from several injuries but they end up winning. Interrogate roughly a surviving attacker and learn they are from the local mafia, allied to the Pyrphorian and charged to take care of any nosey coming around.

Not discrete, are noticed as soon as they try to enter the house. It is not a normal house, it is clearly filled to the roof of armed men, awaiting intruders. A trap! The battle is unbalanced and quickly turn into a slaughter. One young sailor manages to escape while all his comrades are killed.
Spread the crew in the city, ear picking discretely for info

Are spread and discretely occupy the space. Overhear conversations. One if particularly interesting about an unknown man who recently bought a magnificent orange house in the Placa district. Since buying it, the house is constantly guarded and visited by the strangest bunch. Go there.

Do not hear anything of substance but are discrete enough to not have been noticed ear picking. Two sailors suggest to talk to people known for knowing everything about the city habitants: one sailor suggests to talk to the priest, with the confession they always know what nobody else knows. Another suggests to go to the brothel, it is known many secrets are shared when lying in bed.
Go to the church and ask the priest help

Priest see the faith the crew has and believe them when they say the Pyro are to be stopped for the greater good. Tell them that several of his flock have reported being worried about the visitors of a house in the Placa district, bought recently by a wealthy but anonymous man.

Priest is glad to be able to help to crew. "God always help those who put faith in him!" He leads them to a house. "Many of my flock have told me about their fear of the people living there, a faithless organization devoted to evil spirits. It would be real blessing if you deliver us from them." He then leave at once, refusing to part in violence.
Go to the brothel and ask for the prostitutes help

Gladly help. Tell them some of their clients belong to a strange group gathering in a house in the Placa district. Their activities seemed suspicious but they were too proud of themselves not to discard some information about it. Go to the address.
Refuse to help if you don't pay for the service. Time is money.
Pay for the service and have the men behave

Sailors are good guests. Not only pay their parts but also behave correctly. Once the hour ends the Madam decides to give the crew the info they are looking for. Some of their clients belong to a strange group gathering in a house in the Placa district. Their activities seemed suspicious but they were too proud of themselves not to discard some information about it. Go to the address.

After an hour several bottles have been consumed, many words exchanged, the crew is having a great time. One prostitute then asks the crew to follow her to the house of one of her client. "He is part of a strange organization but he is too boastful to keep it for himself. I am sure they are the people you are looking for, they match in every way."
Threaten them
Work. Give right address

Comply, seem afraid of what the crew might do. One prostitute asks the crew to follow her to the house of one of her client. "He is part of a strange organization but he is too boastful to keep it for himself. I am sure they are the people you are looking for, they match in every way."

The crew waits and ear picks for hours but ears nothing. Couldn't handle it more, sailors starts to ask directly to people in the street if they know about the Pyrphorian. Luckily, after they gave a coin to two boys who promised they knew everything going on in the city they agree to lead them to a house where "a strange religious group" gathers often.
The Infiltration

The young man succeeded in getting back to Izabel's island. In panic, he explains that his whole group was slaugthered. He was lucky enough to escape and managed to follow the murderers until he found the Pyrphorians' hide, a big house outside the city. A crew is assembled at once to go there.
The house and its grand French garden around it is seeable from the street but is surrounded by a high fence with two guards at the gate. Many guards are patrolling in the garden. Infiltrating the house won't be easy. Finding the contract there even less.
Play it bold, launch a group assault on the house guards
Attack the two guards at the door, kill them, take their keys and storm in, combat position. The guards are surprised and scattered, easier to get them now before they regroup.
Attack the guards frontally

Take one guard after the next before they have time to form a group and defend each others. In a few minute the beautiful white roses of French garden are painted red. The way to the house is free.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Not good enough and fast enough to kill all the guards before they have a chance to regroup. Gathering their spirit they manage to put on a good defence before they are defeated. A few sailors are injured but they got the upper hand.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Take down the guards from a distance

Fall one after the other. In a few minutes it is silent again, the way to the house is free.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Don't aim well enough. Most guards have time to regroup. Gathering their spirit they manage to put on a good defence before they are defeated. A few sailors are injured but they got the upper hand.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

The crew storms at the two guards at the gate. However while the guards clearly benefited from military training, the crew is more disorganized. The guards manage to hold them just long enough for the reinforcement to regroup before falling, defeated. When the crew opens the gates the bulk of the troop is waiting for them, ready to harvest them.
Let them pierce the crew centre group to surround them on the flanks

Marathon battle style. It works, the guards are defeated. A few sailors are injured but now the road to the house is open.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

A good military strategy is only good when well executed. This move cost more lives than if the un properly trained sailors had fight like they usually do, bar fight style. The battle lasts long and many good men are killed before the crew manages to finally get the upper hand. The road to the house is free but they must clearly act fast to find the contract before the reinforcement come.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Have the captain charge first, giving courage to all

Lord of the Ring style. The captain takes his swords and run toward the guards. The crew follows him and closes on the guards in a few seconds, as if animated by a divine push. The guards are defeated. A few sailors are injured but now the road to the house is open.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Who did he think he was? Hero of ancient tales? At the first blow on their captain the crew conviction that they represent a greater good and will therefore be protected shatters. The battle is a bloodshed like many, nothing heroic about it. Many good men are killed before the crew manages to finally get the upper hand. The road to the house is free but they must clearly act fast to find the contract.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Play it sneaky, have the most discrete man go around the house
Climb above the garden fence discreetly, manage to sneak around and find the kitchen door on the east aisle aside from the patrols. Unfortunately it is closed.
Use the sword as a lever and push

Success, is in.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Make too much noise and even hurt himself in the process. The door resists. The noise of the guards boots is getting closer, he must run away. Hides in a grove but a lot of guards are passing by, alerted by the noise.
Shape a pin to pick the window lock

Success, is in.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
The lock resists the incapable hands.
Risk staying longer and use the sword as a lever

Success, is in
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Makes a lot of noise and even hurt himself in the process. The door resists. The noise attracts the now close guards. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Be safe, leave quickly
The man runs away and hides in a grove. A lot of guards are passing by.

To be as effective as a shadow one must not simply need to move discretely but also pick the right path to do so. While discrete when climbing the fence, the man chose a too risky path and is forced to jump down in a grove. Many patrols are walking around him and it is now too dangerous to back track.
Kill one of the guards and take his uniform

The man is quick and strong. Without having the time to scream or gasp of surprise the guards is on the floor. The man hides him in a grove and take his uniform. He can know walk into the house unsuspiciously.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

Jumping on the guard as fast a possible, the man is not strong enough to knock him in one blow. The guard screams and alerts his companions. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Climb quickly in a tree and wait for the right opening

Manage to climb fast enough to not be spotted. From up there see a balcony with a window open to where he will be able to jump. After a while the sneaky guy has an opportunity to leave his spot and jumps successfully.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Is spotted as he climbs. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Play it subtle, disguise a man as a servant to enter through the main gate
Convincing disguise. "The password?" enquires the guard at the gate.
Hel
Inferno
Hades

"After you sir." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

Good password, enter.
Inside the house, which room to look for?

"After you sir." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
The disguise is absolutely not convincing. "Who are you?" barks the guard. "State your intentions!"
Talk your way in
"Fine but nobody enters without the password!"
Inferno

Right password, enter.
Inside the house, which room to look for?
Hades

"Oh sorry, I didn't realize you were from the house. After you." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
Hel

"Oh sorry, I didn't realize you were from the house. After you." Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.

"Oh of course! Pardon me my lord!" Let the man enter, as soon as he has passed the gate seize him. The poor man is taken, tortured to reveal the position of his fellow crew members. There is no more choice, they will need to fight. The guards are closing on them.
No more talking, launch the assault
You finally have your hands on the Prosperity contract, and with it, the chance to clear your father's name, and by so doing, prevent the outbreak of war between Isabel and Empire.
The Hunter and the Prey

South America at last! After weeks of crossing the ocean your crew takes a well deserved break in the first New World harbour crossing their path. But as the night is falling and the crew is preparing to dock in a bay, the look out screams: "A steam ship is behind us, closing in!!" The captains looks and whispers "The same type of ship Mister Goode's murderer was on. The Pyrophorians found us." The night is dark, the Pyrophorian might not have seen exactly where your ship is.
Battle the Pyrophorians, fire the canons

All the canons are targeting on the same Pyrophorian ship, hoping it will sink or flee, leaving the way open. The crew is well trained, they aim precisely but the balls merely cling on the Pyrophorian's ship hull. A beast of a ship. However, for lookout trained eye, a change is clear: the ship is moving much slower, an engine must have been hit! As the crew were rejoycing, they are suddenly stopped and grasp in terror: a weapon like never before is being loaded on the front of the Pyrophorian ship, an abominable flame thrower. If they don't act fast the crew will be in range!
Target the same spot to immobilize the ship

A great feat of precision and weapon mastery. A great noise can be heard from the Pyrophorian ship, the ship moves for a few more meters and then stops. The crew uses this opportunity to sail away at once, leaving the threatening monster behind, hoping it will never be seen again.

The crew is not well versed enough in cannon mastery to all aim at the same spot. Most balls just fall into the sea or roll on the Pyrophorian ship deck. The mouth of the Pyrophorian's dragon is now right in front of the crew ship, unleashing the fires of hell on the poor men at the balustrade. Numerous men can be seen on board of the Pyrophorian ship, too many to even hope take them down by combat. The Pyrophorian are rearming the flamethrower.
Disable the flamethrower

Manage to disable it expertly, explode right when the crew ship was at enough distance, create a lot of smoke and ashes. It is chaos on board of the Pyrophorian ship. This gives the crew just enough time to sail away without the Pyrophorian being able to block them.

The crew fires the cannons unorderly, not waiting for their own ship to be at a safer distance to do so. The flamethrower explodes, killing Pyro and creating chaos on board but also damaging badly the crew ship and injuring several sailors. The crew takes advantage of the chaos to leave before the Pyro can follow them.
Throw precisely grenades on the Pyrophorian deck
Throw the grenade perfectly, landing every time at the foot of Pyrophorian, killing them on the spot. The chaos created on board leaves enough time for the crew to leave.

Grenades should only be handle by people who know how to throw. While some managed to hit the Pyrophorian, creating chaos on their deck, some also never left the crew ship, killing the unskilled sailor on the spot and injuring several around them. Take advantage of the chaos to leave.
Rely on the sails and the captain mastery, leave the bay at once

The ship goes with the wind. Taking all sails out, manoeuvring the steering wheel perfectly to take the wind from behind, the ship leaves at once, leaving the two remaining Pyrophorian ships far behind. The crew is relieved as they become just dots in the horizon. Surely they won't follow us now.

The Pyrophorian dragon is faster than the captain poor skills allow the ship to be. The mouth of the Pyrophorian's dragon is now right behind the crew ship, it unleashes the fires of hell on the poor men at the balustrade. Numerous men can be seen on board of the Pyrophorian ship, too many to even hope take them down by combat. The Pyrophorian are rearming the flamethrower.

The crew fires the canons in an unordered manner. Many balls just end up diving into the water. The crew has made fool of themselves and made no damage to the Pyrophorian while indicating really clearly their position. The Pyrophorian ship is moving fast toward the crew, the sailors grasp in terror: a weapon like never before is being loaded on the front of the Pyrophorian ship, an abominable flame thrower. The dragon first breath is devastating, several men are injured and the hull damaged.
Disable the flamethrower

Manage to disable it, explode, create a lot of smoke and ashes. It is chaos on board of the Pyrophorian ship. This gives the crew just enough time to sail away without the Pyrophorian being able to block them.

Don't manage to touch the flamethrower, not precise enough, the balls are flying in the air and land in the sea. The Pyrophorian fire again, burning one man to death. They are now so close the warm of the flamethrower is palpable.
Order part of the crew to jump on board and explode the flamethrower with dynamite

It is bold, risky even. The elite soldiers jump on board of the Pyrophorian ship, light dynamite stick and throw them on the flamethrower. The device explodes chaotically, killing several Pyrophorian and injuring the bold sailors. They take advantage of the dense smoke created by the explosion to jump back on the ship as it is leaving the bay, leaving the Pyrophorian to their confusion.

A risky move only the best soldiers could manage, alas the crew has none of them. The soldiers jump on board, fire the dynamite but do not manage to throw them before the Pyrophorian tackle. The explosion which ensue kills all the soldiers on the spot, along with a few Pyrophorian. The confusion allows the rest of the crew to escape but at the cost of their comrades' lives.
Aim at the engine to prevent the ship from moving

Works, the ship moves for a few more meters and stops. While the Pyrophorian manage to burn the stern of the ship while it sails away, the crew still managed to make it out alive without being followed.

It takes time to the inexperience crew to manage to touch the engine despite having all the cannons focused on it. This gives the Pyrophorian the opportunity to launch a new fire attack which is very deadly for a big portion of the crew before their engine is finally disabled and the mourning crew can sail away.
Outrun them, leave the bay while they rearm

Speed itself. Taking advantage of the favourable wind, the crew manages to push the ship to its full capacity. She passes the Pyrophorian ships right before they launch a new fire attack. It was a close call, while the ship is fast the crew feels for days the creeping presence of the Pyrophorian behind them until a few days later the horizon becomes suspiciously clear.

Handling the wind is not an easy feat for beginners. The ship does not cut through the waves fast enough, the Pyrophorian is still too close for the crew to be out of danger. Close enough even for men to be able to jump from the stern on board of the Pyro ship. The firethrower is being rearmed.
Take advantage of the night, skirt the bay and sneak outside

The crew shuts down all the lights, the ship slides on the waves silently, skirting the bay and finding a less protected spot in the blockade. While the dark helps the crew being invisible, it also makes the bay deepness more difficult to estimate. A loud sound resonates as the ship hull is touching the bottom. The ship cannot continue forward without being stuck, taking the time to manoeuvre is necessary to go into safer waters. However the noise has alerted the Pyrophorian ship, it is moving toward the crew, maybe it is better to deal with them first.
Attack the Pyrophorian ship engine to stop his move

Still in pitch darkness, the captain takes advantage of the element of surprise. Discretely, he orders the crew to prepare the canons and waits for the perfect moment the ship is close enough. When it is, he screams fire. All the canons, perfectly aimed, are targeting the ship. In a few perfect blows the engine is touched, the stream ship stops moving. The crew is able to leave.

The crew doesn't know how to manoeuvre the canons discretely. Loading them, gathering the powder, giving order to aim is all made loudly, and rather not very efficiently. By the time the Pyrophorian are in range the sailors are not ready but the Pyrophorian are. Now fully capable of seeing the once hidden crew, they position themselves close to the ship. The crew realizes they are possessing an abominable weapon positioned at the ship front: a monstruous flamethrower. it first blow feels like the fire of Hell have been freed, several men are injured, their fleshes licked by the flames.
Manoeuvre and leave the bay before they can get too close

Manage to use the steering wheel with an extreme precision, move slightly backward and turn in one go. The exit of the bay is close, the manoeuvre was done so fast and efficiently the ship manages to leave the bay before the Pyrophorian catch up.

The manoeuvre takes time, it would have required master skill to pull it through before the Pyrophorian get too close. Now fully capable of seeing the once hidden crew, they position themselves close to the ship. The crew realizes they are possessing an abominable weapon positioned at the ship front: a monstruous flamethrower. it first blow feels like the fire of Hell have been freed, several men are injured, their fleshes licked by the flames.
Disable the flamethrower

Manage to disable it, explode, create a lot of smoke and ashes. It is chaos on board of the Pyrophorian ship. This gives the crew just enough time to sail away without the Pyrophorian being able to block them.

Don't disable it, take high damages from the front. Don't let the Pyrophorian rearming a 3rd time, the captain orders the crew the fill the sails and leave at once before the Pyrophorian crew has the time to reforme into moving position.
Trick the Pyrophorian into following you into the shallow waters

No more need to hide, the captain orders to put on all lights on the ship. The water deepness is now clearly visible. Seeing the hull depth of the Pyrophorian ship is bigger then his, the captain starts a risky manoeuvre into shallow water just deep enough for the crew ship but too shallow for the steam ship. Navigating perfectly into the shallow water, the captain manages to have the ship leave the area while the Pyrophorian ship gets stuck. The way out is open.

While the Pyrophorian do get stuck following the ship into the shallow water, the crew ship also gets damaged. The captain fails the estimate properly the depth of the water and the hull touches the ground. The ship manages to leave the bay but the reparation will take much time and energy.

Navigating discretely is not an easy fit and the crew does not manage to operate a full ship with the lights off and without shooting orders. A few sailors get too loud, the ship is spotted. They are now indicating their position. The Pyrophorian ship is moving fast toward the crew, the sailors grasp in terror: a weapon like never before is being loaded on the front of the Pyrophorian ship, an abominable flame thrower. The dragon first breath is devastating, several men are injured and the hull damaged.

Archie always makes the most fuss over the smallest things…
Every time I ask Archie, I fear his insides combust.
The best thing is, dear old Archie never need know.
When a Queen asks you to do something…
I'm issuing you a royal decree.
I am the Queen after all.
Yes, I jolly well think you will accept.
Bon Voyage, as it is the fashion to say.
Well done, you have my tender affections!
I think we've both earned tea and a slice of sponge cake.
What a daring young one you are!
What gallantry! Though not quite worth a medal.
As reliable as my guards with the funny hats.
I was an obstinate child, and as such can empathise.
And there was I believing I'd found a loyal dachshund.
Need I tell you that you desert your nation!
Like my coronation, a farce from beginning to end.
My father would have had your head!
Don't be afraid to hurry, we are happy to wait!
Queens usually like things done quickly.
At least bring me some tea if nothing else!
You have served your Queen well, will you serve her again?
It is a trying time for the Empire, and we need you yet...
Your support is a comfort we would much like to continue.
Who could possibly be more important than your Queen?
I have not left the Palace in haste to be denied!
Have you succeeded in your mission?
Has my loyal subject returned?
I am told you may have something for me?
I'll call upon you, subject, if I need you.
There's nothing to keep you occupied here but my puppies.
Dear Archie has everything under control.
Oh do stop, Archie. Is this tiny fleet all I have to sink to get my island back?
Who are you, to speak up without permission?
So Edvard is the traitor! I certainly never authorised that silly-billy to act on my behalf. I declare the contract null and void.
Then I suppose we'll not be sinking any ships today. Not even as a deterrent?
Well in that case I hereby declare Prosperity returned to the Goode children—to compensate the dead father, thereby ensuring Miss Sarmento and co. are safe from this Pyrphorian nuisance.
What is that tinseled marionette talking about, Archie? We are safe here, aren't we?
Look at all those subjects! How enthusiastic they seem! Do you think they celebrate me, their royal highness?
And you are absolutely sure this Samuel Goode was innocent?
Let's heal it then, and be off.
My sincerest condolences, children of Samuel. For the loss of the father you loved, and for the tragedy caused by the unfortunate actions of your uncle.
For your unquestionable loyalty and bravery you shall be knighted, and bequeathed the island of Bright Sands from now and forevermore!
Hahaha... Forgive me, I always laugh at funerals!
But another tiresome prophet of doom, Archie. How dreary!
These rebels, whoever they are, will pay the penalty for challenging my sovereignty!
The time has come to take that territory back by force.
Funny, ending a war over a bit of paper!
I must admit, I am too fond of my sailors.
I understand this means the end of a rebellion on the island, very good.
So is it Isabel who is nice, or the Pyrphorians?
As long as we have Prosperity back, that business with your father can be forgotten.
So Edvard was the nasty one, and Samuel was the one with the dandruff?
Fancy forging a signature. People can be terrible, can't they?
I'm surprised that Isabel gave it back without a fight.
Once built, your Court of Justice shall inaugurate a new era of peace and prosperity for Empire.
This trial should be a celebration! A toast to all things civilised.
I don't normally attend trials so this one must be important.
You now own the highest court in the land!
The Court of Justice, magnificent!
Is the Court of Justice finished yet? Not quite?
I can't wait to play judge and give the gavel a sharp tap!
Did Archie tell you I planned to visit? I hope there's a convenient mooring for my flagship. I don't like long walks.
Treat me as you would any other guest.
Just so you know, I am not fond of garlic or profiteroles.
One approves! And it is nice to get out and about.
It all sounds very cheery so far. Make it cheerier.
Mind you, I do like it when things are special. You can do special?
May I express my gratitude for your sterling work preserving peace on the continent.
So this is the funny little island that's hosting the trial! Jolly good.
Now I'm here, I am of course impatient for the trial to begin.
A modern Queen must show she is able to dispense mercy. The man must be given fair hearing.
Where are all the witnesses?
Now we are finally all present, let this long overdue trial commence!
And where's the defendant?
This is all rather unusual. We are safe here?
This is unexpected. You are taking care of those beastly malefactors, aren't you?
A few angry hoodlums can't overthrow an Empire, can they?
I thought they must be after fame or riches, but they want to kill me.
I wonder what has become of the royal fleet…
Tell me they are not attacking this island? The one we are on?
I surrender myself wholly to your security arrangements.
I suppose then, my safety is in your hands.
When we get out of this I promise you a whole duchy. Although, no, I can't actually promise that.
We are so happy to be finally allowed to leave this island. And for your heroism of course.
Under different circumstances, you might have called it a pleasant visit!
I'm sure we can make Isabel's tiny little chunk a protectorate of some sort.
It makes one feel frisky and alive!
We ARE amused!
This suits us very well.
How wonderful to have it our own way!
How mischievous one feels!
It has all gone off very satisfactorily!
All is much as it should be.
Be strong in business, and become a pillar of our nation.
You continue to be of the greatest use to us.
Your successes must be a source of pride.
We appreciate your efforts.
Parliament commends you exceedingly.
You slide easily about the board like the rook!
You are a very able servant of the realm.
We are not amused!
The Queen regrets this distressing affair.
Another Queen may have turned to execution by now.
It is gravely injurious to our nation.
One wants prompt action against such outrage.
It is a time of discord for those of my station.
One of the many threats to my position.
The Queen finds your conduct inexcusable!
My father would have had you executed!
You WILL do better!
What a perilously selfish subject you are!
Your Queen is displeased with you.
Parliament will discuss what shall be done with you.
Tantamount to treason!
If it please an all-powerful deity to place me on the throne, it shall certainly please you...
I am your Queen. What further introduction is needed?
Have you met Nelson? Why he's a chestnut stallion with an Arabian head.
Oh pooh to 'your highness', call me ma'am.
I was beginning to enjoy being alone for once.
I long for some gaiety - a play or an opera.
I am fond of pleasant society, are you that?
No interruption fatigues, if it benefits the nation.
The dogs bite traitors and loyal alike, so they aren't much help.
A discretionary fleet for national emergencies.
I want to be a spearhead not a figurehead.
We do not solicit violence, yet under my rule it seems as constant as the crashing waves.
I do not forget the sacrifice of these sailors on my account.
Then we owe our gratitude.
It is much admired.
Sincere thanks for attending to this matter.
It would be prudent to accept.
Oh, we are only too happy to agree.
We shall be delighted.
Apparently my father disliked babies. I think I shall be as decisive, but slightly less mad.
It doesn't matter what you think of me, it is what I think of you.
Archie has been like a father to me, his company fills me with all those paternal hopes and comforts.
Archie never stops me eating jam, and will suffer the subsequent indigestion for me too!
If not for Archie, the rest would still be leading me up and down stairs like an infant.
Lady Margaret Hunt, née Harlow, is a respected voice on the Royal Council.
Sarmento is a strong woman, let us hope she keeps no secrets from us.
Anne Harlow must know that no injustice can excuse her own crimes.
Jean La Fortune is a pirate whose name I too-commonly hear.
The council has agreed my prison reforms, so I hope Mr. Bleakworth will bend a little.
Miss Jorgensen is a distant relative. Although all my relatives are quite distant.
I understand we have visiting royalty in Princess Qing. She's a gentle soul.
Willie Wibblesock? A made-up name surely?!
It's Mr von Malching. I will never offer that awful man a barony.
The presence of Vicente Silva is clearly an attempt by La Corona to challenge my authority here.
Shame Queens can't chop heads anymore.
Heaven forbid!
If that is a joke, it is not a funny one.
Pull up your braces, and thrust into the unknown!
If you pop off now, you'll be back in time for tennis!
Know that any assistance may influence Her Majesty's sphere!
Alas, my bowels churn afresh and I must beg your expertise...
Now here is a vital matter, of Queen and country!
Righty-ho!
Jolly Roger!
Buckaroo!
That really is first-rate.
I am quite penetrated by your kindness.
Bish-bang-bibbly, there she blows!
Ideally, one should keep one's promises.
Now, now. You oughtn't waste people's time.
Didn't finish? Ah. Um…hmmn…
Failed? I feel a ghastly surge coming on.
Caught trousers down? Happens to the best of us!
Her Majesty has little patience, I'd skip to it if I were you!
Have you heard the expression, 'a stitch in time saves nine' …
Resting? Perhaps you'd like my latest; male torso in rosewood!
Much has moved since we spoke, but I can still count on you?
I fear I must call upon you again, in spite of your good work.
I confess these unseemly troubles gurgle on, hope you don't mind?
Loyalty to the crown really should come above all else …
Only Her Majesty has your best interests at heart.
Oh, you're ready?
Had a rip-roaring time of it?
Brought some joy?
Nothing just now, but we value your eagerness!
If you return a little later, I may have something…
Pop back another time, and I'll fill your stocking.
Apart from security, I appreciate the company!
Two's the charm!
Well well, chosen for a royal escort!
I'm here if ever you need a steady, albeit somewhat arthritic, hand to guide you.
Sir Archibald Blake, Her Majesty's moist mouthpiece!
One-piece underwear suits? Too prickly! I find singleton shorts and vests to be tried and true!
Weird and wonderful!
I'm sure ma'am shall be delighted!
Superlative!
Suitably regal!
Her Majesty might approve!
Comforting as a moist and springy sponge!
Well that certainly settles the stomach!
You're a credit to the Empire!
You're constant, and that is key!
Perhaps a peerage is on the cards?
Majesty will soon be mentioning you.
I knew you'd come through!
You're flourishing!
You're a national treasure!
Her Majesty will be discomfited…
There's an unpleasant waft in the air.
Heavens, what shall I tell her majesty?
Oh, horsefeathers.
This brings on my indigestion.
I'm suddenly hot under the collar.
Pshaw, I shan't sleep at all.
You put me in a difficult position…
I wouldn't wish to accuse you of disloyalty…
Perhaps think again on the situation?
I fear you've made things awkward…
Might I advise against your current course?
Now we don't want to have a contretemps.
It's not that we don't trust you entirely…
I present my humble duty to you, and am confident you'll transcend your present circumstance!
I am a humble servant of Her Majesty, called upon for delicate occasions such as these.
Taking the initiative - excellent!
What a jolly jolly surprise.
Ah yes, the bright young sapling!
I present my humble duty to you.
Don't tell me I've missed another appointment?
Sir Archibald Blake, how may I serve?
Anyone for croquet?
We prepare for the worst but hope for the best.
Our humble little Empire.
The King is dead, long live the Queen!
The street layout was positively Byzantine until recent times.
Her Majesty's finest!
A lustrous jewel in the crown!
Every ship needs a stiff rudder!
An Empire covers both land AND sea!
Ma'am and I are much obliged!
A royal acknowledgement is due!
Sir Archibald gives his thanks.
Naturally!
But of course!
Oh, most assuredly!
I fear that may be impossible.
The thought makes me wince!
Oh my aching organs, no.
As a boy, I was chased through the palace by a disgruntled goose, honking and hissing! I had its egg, you see. Once I'd given it back, the goose and I became firm friends.
Tolerance, sympathy, understanding. Supreme qualities in a monarch wishing for a happy reign.
Her Majesty rarely needs guidance - ah, a little here and there - I think she simply likes to have my company.
Ever carved a lovespoon from walnut? I did have an amour once, but matters of state drew us apart.
As Her Majesty's adjutant, I must be quietly attentive. The merest smile on her face is enough!
Viscount Guffington-Hawkmoth, wounded at his own estate. It brings to light Her Majesty's very present vulnerability.
Bless Her Majesty, she eats so fast, but when she stops, so must we!
Her Majesty's rare gift is a soft heart and a hard mind. With monarchs, it is too often the reverse!
Anne Harlow's fall from grace was stormy and unpleasant, a bit like my bowels.
George Smith has a marvellous walking cane of alder, with tasteful silver flourishes.
Aha...Jean La Fortune. We'd like to have helped, but it's rather gone beyond that now.
Isabel Sarmento? You should probably be careful where you speak that name.
Mr. Bleakworth may seem a blinkered horse, but is very well-suited to his task at the prison.
When running errands for Her Majesty, I often find myself in Madame Kahina's exquisite company.
Miss Jorgensen is a far relation of Her Majesty, if I'm not mistaken. They do both share a certain boldness...
We have made every conceivable dispensation for Princess Qing, as we are compelled to do with visiting royalty!
We auditioned this Wibblesock for Her Majesty's fifteenth birthday, sadly the rabbit didn't survive the hat.
Beryl O'Mara has flies on the wall, as I only dream our own discrete services might.
Her Majesty wearies of Mr. von Malching's pinguid claims to a non-existent barony.
I worry Artur Gasparov might one day appear at the palace better-dressed than her majesty.
Pure pleasure …
All in Her Majesty's name.
More flexible than you imagined!
The royal seal upon it!
I can finally let go that pent-up gas!
Customs and excise, eh!
Duty done, time for a kip!
Oh dear, lost your flagship? Well, I'll see what I can rustle up...
We can't deny it's a difficult time. The sale of Prosperity was highly destabilising for Her Majesty.
Debt free? Spiffing, just the dib-dab. One splendid licence we shall draw up forthwith.
As to the debt my hands are tied, but it may warm her majesty's heart to see a new enterprise taking shape.
Did he really…? Oh dear, best leave these poor people with me. I will tell Edvard that the debt between you is quite settled…
What is it you are bringing?
I will let Edvard know that I have granted you your shipping licence.
We also hear on the grapevine, of your commendable intention to establish your own shipping company…
Her Majesty warmly invites you to trade in sovereign harbours, at your own discretion of course.
So you build ships like your father? Well, the Queen is in the direst need of ships.
Supporting her will go some way to healing the wounds of the past.
These reinforcements will please Her Majesty! Though it remains my hope no war will be necessary.
I read in the papers you build ships like your father. His actions have likely led to war, so it would be strangely fitting if you were to supply the Queen's fleet.
You are doing Her Majesty a great service in these difficult times.
How are those ships coming along? Her Majesty will be pleased.
Her Majesty wants only warships. It is after all important in such times that she defends her sovereignty.
We rely more and more on captains of industry to steer us to happy futures.
This symbol is a death threat?! But Her Majesty received one identical! Upon a plain envelope, with a stamp from the colonies!
We still don't know how your father was involved in all this, but I fear the answer lies west.
Your father sold Prosperity to the leader of the rebels Isabel Sarmento.
The sale of Prosperity, made in Samuel's name, has weakened Her Majesty's position greatly.
Ever since the deal, Isabel has been hiding from us. But you may be the one to find her.
After the excellent work you are doing for the fleet, I think you're entitled to pursue the odd personal matter.
I wish as much as you that your father were innocent in this.
Those very serious accusations against your father are hard to dismiss without proof to the contrary.
You digging around in state matters isn’t ideal, but in this case may be necessary.
That these ''Pyrphorians'' may have spread their influence in the New World is grave news indeed.
The situation closer to home is already difficult. Her Majesty has come under increasing scrutiny from many sides.
Her Majesty may go to war with Isabel. That is why she is mustering a fleet.
Isabel will be cagey, but I think she with time may listen to us.
Isabel may not trust you to begin with. But remember, neither did I!
You may find Isabel fiercely independent. But I trust in you to bring her round.
I fear Her Majesty will not care to know the difference between these Pyrphorians and the local rebellion. So we'll have to leave that to you.
I wish you the best, for Queen and country!
Her Majesty is on edge. You'd better keep things ticking along with Isabel.
However Prosperity fell into the wrong hands, it really needs to be set right before Her Majesty sends the fleet.
The Queen really is ready to do something drastic. We don't have a lot of leeway.
Do not underestimate the efficiency of the Pyrphorian machine. Wheels no doubt turn turn as we speak.
Her Majesty wants Prosperity back. By whatever means necessary...
Prosperity was our key to unlock the region. The Empire stands to lose greatly from that deal.
We have little influence in new world waters now, you are the one diplomatic weapon we have.
Most of us want a peaceful conclusion from this Prosperity business.
Her Majesty will soon go to war with Isabel over Prosperity. Any other solution would be preferable.
You would be doing a great service for Queen and country.
With that document we can still reverse the original deal.
Then it was Edvard that sold Prosperity. I didn't want to believe it, but I had my suspicions.
Her Majesty is very quick on the trigger. We must some how avoid her coming to blows.
Her Majesty will soon arrive upon her charger, sword aloft.
You have averted war most delicately! Her Majesty may thank you, in time.
Good, but there's little time. Her Majesty has her campaign chart out on the table!
A whole nation is behind you, though they do not know it.
Our Empire is spread too thin to countenance another war at this time.
Now war has been averted, an alliance with Isabel might even be of mutual benefit…
With the Pyrphorian presence on Prosperity neutralised, the island can be freely returned to its rightful keeper.
The Pyrphorians will no doubt regroup elsewhere.
Isabel needn't be an enemy to us, now Prosperity is back in safe hands.
I think it's better you break the bad news to Edvard. Let him know his gambit is over.
A terrible business. Edvard must be put now to trial.
